text: Great restaurant. Went here last night for the first time and was pretty happy with everything. The build your own burger concept was great and at little cost. You essentially just pay for the meat and any special toppings in which everything else comes free. I chose to have zucchini fries with my burger (+$1) which was well worth it. My significant other wanted an appetizer which was pretty basic. I would skip the apps here. Not much of a beer selection either if thats what your looking for.  All in all very delicious burgers and would definitely go back.

Went in for lunch and was unusually slow for the location. Saw a dead cockroach in the bathroom and figured out why. Can't determine where the fowl smell is coming from but the aroma of the burger overpowered my urge to vomit in my lipstick stained glass. If that coffee was Seattle's Best I'd hate to taste their worst...wanted to sit outside but between the heat and the oxidizing white chairs, I sat inside at a booth I could watch TV In. Lots of high quality TV's but they need to get the sports package...
Great food everytime. The ingredients are fresh and every wait person is super friendly and helpful. Amber is great!

I'm not usually one to write a review, but I have been to Blu Burger about 6 times and I am continuously impressed with not only the food, but the amazingly consistent and outstanding service!  I love their beer selection, burgers and happy hour menu! I usually go there with my 3 kids and as a server myself, I sometimes cringe when I see a bunch of kids come in, but the staff at Blu is always friendly and extra attentive!  This is by far my favorite place to take the family or grab a beer with my friends!  Well done Blu Burger.... keep up the great work!

My boyfriend and i went there last night for the first time and we weren't very impressed. The service was fast &friendly, We ordered the buffalo potato chips with the blue cheese dressing and they were pretty good. I ordered the blu burger and o found it very dry and the caramelized onions over powered everything else in the burger. My boyfriend ordered the southwest burger which was drenched in  the chipotle "mayo" . Overall we would not recommend this place.

I am giving this place 4 stars because it is called blu burger not blu chicken. I must say that I have been here 3 times and haven't had anything bad but prefer the chicken sandwiches to the burgers. Although there is a large selection of toppings, I am rating the quality of the burger itself. The burger is nothing specials but the array of toppings make it pretty good. I enjoy the fact that they are pet friendly because I might stop in after the doggie wash or some other outing that includes my fur baby. I personally prefer a few other places for burgers. A chicken sandwich with gorgonzola, bacon, caramelized onion and anyone of their delicious mayos is a great meal and large enough for me to eat twice!

Love this place. The Salmon is amazing here and I love love love their salads. Great service from Desiree and it's a perfect lunch spot. Love sitting outside when the weather is good. Prices have gone up though as of late so I don't know if we will be frequenting as much as we used to.
Great Amercian Burger! Amazing service! Brilliant interior! The burger was delicious but it was a little big. It's a great restraunt good for any occasion.

I walked over to this place after the gal in Olive Gourmet recommended it. I am very happy that i did.   I came in during lunch and there was no wait. It had a nice, relaxed atmosphere.   The waitress (I think her name is Desiree or Denise) was wonderful! She had an awesome sense of humor and was fast, courteous, and genuine. She also had killer food recommendations, and i was so happy i went with them.   I got the green chile burger. It actually had a good flavor and a nice kick. For a side, I got the sweet potato fries. They were crisp, salted, and delicious.   I would definitely come back here again! I just wish it was closer to home.

Came to this place a while back and, while the food was pleasant, I cannot say that there was anything to set this place apart from the other restaurants in the area. The food was good, but slightly overpriced given that you are essentially buying a burger and fries. The staff is generally good at service, but overhearing employees talk about their personal life (especially where the management joins the conversation) usually makes for an awkward time. This is a place for people looking for a new experience; otherwise, I would recommend one of the other restaurants in the area.

I went here on a Thursday afternoon. There were about four other people there. However I think we just got there before the rush because at least 3 other groups of people showed up after us. I had the habanero burger with sweet potato fries. The burger had the flavor of habanero but lacked the heat, which I liked. The sweet potato fries were well done. I ordered the burger Medium well and it was cooked to perfection.The staff was very friendly and service was fast. The only thing I can say bad about it is they only had one table for six people. So I guess if you want to go here, bring only 5 people. When it's all said and done, I'd definitely go here again.

Well, my brother came back early from NYC and came over so we decided to go out to eat and we have been wanting to try Blu Burger for a while now.  It is a higher end burger place but casual.  They are a Build Your Own Burger restaurant.  My wife got the Angus Burger, my brother got the Turkey burger and I got the Chicken breast.  We all added the toppings we liked and all gave it 4 stars.  On mine, I got BBQ sauce, jalapeno, habanero sauce, and gorgonzola  cheese on a whole wheat bun with sweet potato fries.  The presentation was very good and the food was delicious.  My wife likes her burgers medium rare, and a lot of restaurants wont do this any more so she was happy they would.  She said it was cooked right and was very juicy.  Service was good and we will definitely be back.

I love this place. The staff is super friendly and the owner always makes it a priority to come over to the tables to make sure everything is good. My personal favorite here is the Blu Chicken or the Turkey burger. Both really good ....oh and you have to get the zucchini fries as a side they are the best. I also like the fact that you have the option to build your own burger, then you get everything you want and nothing you don't. Also the location is a plus the movie theater being right across the street is great, always nice to get great service, delish food and get to catch a movie after. I would recommend this place to anyone and do actually recommend it to my friends. :)   Thank You, Jaime

This was our first visit to Tru Burger. Ivry our server was very nice and explained menu items well. Great personality. The California Burger was amazing. We tried the Green Bean Fries w/wasabi ranch. They were great. Excellent experience.

Hubby and I were underwhelmed by both the atmosphere and the food. I ordered a build your own burger. While the patty itself was cooked as I like it and it was tasty, they skimped on the cheese and though the bun looked toasted, it was COLD!  I took two bites and then proceeded to just eat the fries. My meal wasn't bad...but it wasn't good. I then understood why the place was barely half full on a Friday night while the place directly across the street was jam packed with a 40 minute wait.

Stopped in for a burger on an impulse and got the BBQ burger. It was absolutely amazing. I haven't been impressed with a meal in a long time. It also helped having such friendly service from my server Brandi. I will return many times.
Enjoyed the Blu Burger and the buffalo chips. Friendly staff and attentive. I look forward to my next trip

Amber our server was great! Our first time here so she gave us a run down of how the place worked along with some excellent suggestions. Killer happy hour. Big portions for happy hour apps starting at $3 and $2 beers.  You can't go wrong. Great burgers too.

UPDATE.....I rated Blu Burger a while back and said that I did not see a colored tint to my burger which is true but I went back a few days ago and we sat in a different spot and my whole burger patty was GREEN! lol it was weird at first but I knew it wasnt rotten or anything it was just the lighting,hubbys salmon wrap was also green. It was still delicious though! so pretty much it depends on where you sit and what time of the day it is,the later it is the more colored your patty will be and if you sit more towards the back in the booths I found thats when your patty turns green :)

Being a restaurant that bases itself around burgers, you'd think that they'd be able to cook them properly. Unfortunately this is not the case. Second time to this location and both times the burgers were obviously overcooked (first time the burger was terribly under-seasoned and the second time terribly over-seasoned--perhaps a Breathalyzer should be installed in the kitchen?). I'm uncertain as to whether they train the line-cooks to touch a burger to test for tenderness (which helps with gauging for how done a patty is, seeing that the cooks here need help with that). The service was generally inattentive and absent-minded. However, if the meat weren't overcooked, it might have been quality meat. In the restaurant business, though, often the older meat is sent out to people who order "well-done" (blasphemy). Blu Burger Grille seems to just send out the old, scorched meat to anybody if there's any laying around, is my guess.  Too much for a sub-par burger. I'd rather go back to In-N-Out (blargh). In short, if you have low-expectations or are drunk and wanting to overpay for a meal, you'd love this joint.  Two stars because the bartender made a rather good dirty martini.  Please, to the owner, skip the condescending "apologetic comment" to this review. You screwed up twice and pretty badly. Learn and move on.

My wife and I had a wonderful late lunch at Blu Burger Grille today.  This was our first visit.  The restaurant was very clean and inviting and the stall, especially our server Anna, were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.  My wife had a signature burger and regular fries and I had a "build-a-burger" and sweet potato fries.  Both burgers were gourmet in every sense!  My sweet potato fries were the best I've had!  If you can't find (or build) the burger of your dreams at Blu Burger Grille it would be amazing.  We will definitely come back!

This was the worst burger joint that I have ever eaten at, and I would know because I am a big time burger junkie, its one of my favorite foods! First off we went on a monday at 1pm so there was no one in the joint, so you would think when you ask for a burger to be cooked at medium, they would perfect it!!!! But no i get, what they call "perfect kobe beef burger," cooked at a charcoal blackened nasty mess! And to top it off there was a hair in my fries, and of course i didnt ask them to make me a new burger because i said if this is what i get when im the only table in here, i cant expect the second go around to be any better! Needless to say, I will never eat here again, and I do not recommend it to anyone else. Especially since i paid 13 for a Kobe Beef burger, that looked like something you get from the walmart meat section!

I had the chance to talk to the owner after a few missed communication attempts and was able to let him know my experience happened before my review and was pleased to receive an apology and that was greatly appreciated!!! In my opinion just reaching out shows that he cares and values his customers opinion. I will defantly give them a try again.

Excellent burger choices! I built my own, which was the best choice IMO. Best party is the burger was actually cooked to the doneness I asked for!! That is worth 4 stars alone. Prices were very reasonable too, $10/burger and $5/beer. Service was all also excellent.  No reason i wouldn't find an excuse to come back! 5 stars.

I have only been here once but my experience was good. The cheese fries were very good the burger was good too I don't really have anything negative to say it's a small place though so if you're with a large group I don't think this place is ideal for you. It's a sitdown restaurant but it's kind of an in and out feel.

Food is always spot on, haven't had one bad plate yet. Club house sandwich was delicious side of sweet potatoe fries, wife had the Blu Chicken, shared each others halves. Service was good talking care of things and a water dish for the pups. Get here early as they do have early hours during the week.

It's an alright place. Their burgers are ok. My opinion, the burger portion is a little large, maybe a little too seasoned. Their fries are plain, nothing I would eat alone. I can't really find a charm to my experience or the place, its just ok. Would eat here again if around the are, but nothing I'd go out of my way for. Something I'd like to point, I've seen this place before, never though to visit, the outside looks like it's a place to a "healthy" burger place. I will go back a second time and update this review.

I have given this place five stars in the past but it has gone way down hill. The meat on my burger was tasteless. In my opinion when you don't toast the bun, your not even trying to make a good burger. Our waitress was very friendly, which goes a long way with me but, that burger was bad! I do realize that places have off days so I gave them another chance. Unfortunately, my burger and my husbands burger were the same. Unseasoned meat, untoasted bun = not a good burger :-( What happened to the delicious burgers they use to make? I'm giving them two stars only because our waitress was great!

I am a Tru Burger fan from when it was called Blue Burger. My wife thins their Turkey Burger is the best she has ever had. I had the "special" which was the Pastrami Burger and it was very good. Just the write balance of ingredients. They are a little pricy in my opinion but worth the expense occasionally. Staff is friendly. Cook is a little slow. But, all in all, we will be back!!

My food was "ok" too much bun for the burger and pretty greasy. The server was very friendly and attentive and so was the bus boy.   I was very offended by the owner yelling at our server, who was doing a great job,  for being "too attentive"  we are regulars at other restaurants typically because we enjoy the atmosphere which the server usually has a lot to do with.  He was rude and harsh! Then came back and "acted" very nice to us after we just witnessed the way he treated her. He should have paid more attention to the 2 servers gossiping about him at the front door. (We were seated at the 1st table and could hear their very inappropriate conversation)  We will not return and will not recommend!

This was an amazing meal! We started out with the green bean fries and wasabe sauce, then we both did the build your own burger. The veggie burger is the best I've ever had.  He had the Kobe beef and he loved it.
Its one of the best burgers i've tasted in a long time because its not raised with antibiotics and it also doesnt have growth hormones

I was craving a burger.  So I went to Blu Burger and boy did it hit the spot.  The ingredients were fresh and tasty. I really enjoyed the location.  You can bring dogs on the patio. So next time my dogs will join me. :)
Worth the wait.   Very long wait time to take our order, despite having plenty of staff. Burger was very good.

Order the blu burger, it is wonderful, the combination of caramelized onions, gorgonzola cheese and applewood bacon is divine.   They also have a build your own burger options which is nice.   The sweet potato fries are excellent and the service is fabulous.   They are now serving breakfast on Saturdays and Sundays, can't wait to try it.

Since management has change the quality of food has also change. Very disappointing and the prices are on the higher end. I do not believe it is worth going back or even trying again. Customer service is awesome however not great enough to go back to try the food again.

On occasion I would see this place and I've always wanted to go in and try it. Well I finally did and it was good! I really liked how they allowed you to build your own burgers in many delicious Ways. If you're a burger person you need to stop in and check this place out oh yeah the zucchini fries were also very delicious!

Went here on Father's Day. Good burger but even better show!!!   We watched the servers and manager go round and round.  Clearly employee and manager issues.  It was like a live Ramsey series.  You may need to go when it is cooler out. The air must not keep up with all the windows.  Employees had their own personal battery powered fans so this must not have been a one time event.    What an odd experience.

Good place!!! Had the pear salad which was served in a trough and could've served everyone in the restaurant!  Was very good and thankfully the salad wasn't soggy from the warm chicken!  We had the buffalo chips and for homemade chips, they were so crispy!  I definitely will be back!

Blu Burger is A-OK for me. I like the fact that they offer grass fed beef and bison burgers.  You can create your own, which is what I would  recommend.    Both their grass fed and bison burgers are very good.  You have several choices of toppings starting with their bun - wheat, onion or white.  I do think their buns are too big and found myself removing the top bun so I could enjoy the taste of the beef and bison.  Get their roasted red pepper sauce and add a few toppings to go with it.  Skip their fries, they tasted pre-frozen and go for their zucchini fries.  They are a bit mushy inside but crispy on the outside.

I was very pleased with Blu Burger. The service was good, the food was good and I liked the atmosphere. I got the habanero burger with onion rings. The waitress said the habo sauce was very hot and it would be best if it was put on the side. I said sure. I'm glad she did as it wasnt too hot, but I didnt really care for the flavor. A1 as the sauce, much better. The wife got the American burger. I got a bite of that and it was very good also. She got regular fries and the were good with malt vinegar. We split a fried cheesecake desert with caramel sauce. I'm not much on sweet things, but it was very good as well. Next time I think I'll get a Kobe burger. It is quite a bit more expensive than your average sit down burger joint.  I think its probably third on my list. 5 guys and Fuddruckers. 5 guys is the best hands down. This isnt really part of the review, but I just kept thinking, Grimaldi's is next door. Oh how I live Grimaldi's.   Strong 4 stars. It was like $40 with tip and we didnt get any alcohol. I read on their website, mon and tues are buy one burger get one free with buying 2 drinks.
This place had some good food! I had the hot pastrami: to die for. I really enjoyed it. It was a pretty big sandwhich with Swiss cheese, cole slaw, and 1000 island dressing.

The Blu Burger Survey on yellow sheet paper - I have been coming to Blu Burger for many years - I miss the Freshness it use to be - Fresh Bread - Fresh Garlic Rolls with Fresh Moist Salmon & the Fresh Green Salad. The Salmon use to cover the whole roll now its really thin & dried out & does not cover the whole roll. RIPP OFF. I was there on 08/28/2014 and as the last time my Salmon was DRIED out & the Greens were Wilty  The Bread was way to done to & it was COLD when it was served to me. The bathroom did not smell this time around. I brought my friend over here for her birthday lunch she had the Cobb Salad & she enjoy it.  My meal was awful. Just saying. The owner came over to say hi & he has talked to me one other time & I shared to him what I thought. Of course he did not like constructive criticism. There was this nagging dirty fly flying around our food and as I was paying for our meal the fly fell on my receipt in the black waitress book & I told the waitress by the way the fly that has been dreadfully flying around our table dropped dead in your black book. She looked in her book & walked away - she did not say a word. I will never bring anymore friends over this way. I use t o come in with my seniors & husband for we use to take them to the movies or I go to Victoria Secret.  Quality is really BAD - Prices are UP & no more Greatness or Freshness in  this place. They did managed to get all new bathroom put in - it use to be when you walk in the bathroom the drain on the floor always had water around it & it really stunk in there.  I had to ask for Refills for our Water to - the waitress never came over after she served our food & ask how everything was. She came by like 20 minutes later & we had  NO Water. Bahh.... I have been coming here since 2010. My husband & I came in here all the time & it use to be FRESH & GREAT. 4 years later really went down hill usually bad Quality Food. I asked how fresh the Salmon was (always do) The owner said he orders his Salmon every 2 days. I think for this price it should be brought in daily for it's Poultry - Poultry should not be sitting around. I teach the obesity on how to eat & read ingredients & Blu Burger use to be very selective on their Quality of Food Choice. Not No more. Janine Evans

The menu offers chili nachos,  but I asked if they would make me some chili fries. They were so nice & accommodated my request. The best chili fries I've had! Then I ordered the California burger which was absolutely delicious.  I highly recommend it. The $1 extra charge for the zucchini fries was a steal. Blu Burger is my new goto when I'm craving a juicy,  yummy burger!

Heard a lot about this place and thought to give it a try today with my wife. I Loved the bison burger, very flavourful and jucy. my wife ordered the kobe and said the best burger she has ever had. Will definitely be back.

Amber made the visit fantastic. The portions were generous and her recommendation for the green bean fries was spot on.  We also got the Buffalo chips which were delicious. I made my own burger and it was delicious and cooked just right.

We went to the movie right door , we just decided to try it out. The place was cute love the patio especially with the great weather we are having . The server where trying to figure who was going to take our order , finally we got a server . It took  about 40 minutes to get our burgers. They were ok .  I did had to send mine back to cook some more it was rare.Our bill came to  $36 for 2 burger,fries, and 2 sodas. Are you serious!!!
Food was delicious and our server Brianna was a doll! Only compliant is that its pretty hot in there, needs a better ac!!!

I went here one day because I was starving on a Sunday evening. Grimaldis was cleaning their oven so I stepped in to try something new. This is now my favorite burger place! The Blu Burger is ahhhhh-mazing! Service was awesome as well.   Craving a burger? You need to make a trip and check this place out.

Just went in here 1/19/17 and there was a smell so strong we had to leave.  The restrooms were giving it off and it makes the whole place smell like a urinal. I understand it may not be the companys fault as it looks like they have a sewage smell issue with the building but they need to let the owners of the property know so as a fix may happen if not I doubt many will go in sorry.

Built my own bison burger which was delicious you can't really go wrong with a burger. Meat was cooked just as I wanted. Ordered a side of sweet potato fries and was disappointed. They were dry and over cooked. They were more like sweet potato chips because they were hard and crunchy. Service was alright not the best I've had. The decor is hideous the blue windows can really hurt the eyes. I would recommend eating outside, inside smells terrible like they have a bad sewer line. You think they would fix the problem.
Delicious and fresh, build your own hamburger and fast customer service . Definitely new favorite place

RACIST, RACIST, RACIST! If I could give 0 stars, I would! Decided to give this place a try after moving into the apartments here at Park West and I wasn't even there 5 minutes before I left! Walked in and patiently waited to be seated with my friend while several employee stood around. After a few minutes, a couple walked in behind us and was immediately acknowledged. When we told the server that we were waiting to be seated, she told us to seat ourselves! Did I mention we are black? Couple was white of course. I would never recommend this place to anyone for any reason!
Food was awesome will come back again husband had chicken wings also good. Very nice waitress

Went to Blu Burger on a recommendation  from a family member.  We are visiting and don't know the area enough to know where to eat.  It was a casual environment with friendly staff.  Food was delicious.   Made my own burger and everything tasted fresh.  My zucchini fries were cooked perfectly.  The burger itself was tasty and cooked exactly as ordered.  Even the kiddos meals were tasty as I sampled a couple of their regular french fries cooked crispy but not overdone.  My husband enjoyed the southwest burger as well.  Will definitely be coming again.

We ordered 3 burgers and one of them didn't even have a bun on it. The other one was rare when I asked for well done. The food also had no flavor at all, worst burger I ever had in my life! I rather eat McDonald's. Over priced for trash food. I recommend no ones comes to eat at tru bum burgers...

I have tried to give this place a chance and this is 3rd time I have been and I just had to write this review. There is a reason that all the other restaurants in park west are busy with the exception of this place.  We went in on a slow Sunday afternoon we stood up there waiting to be sat for at least 5 minutes.  There was only two servers and both were very lax. Our server forgot our appetizer.. didn't even have it on our receipt and I don't think she realized that she forgot it.  An order was messed up and took too long to get it fixed so my daughter just ended up eating at home. And of course because service was so slow,  our food was ice cold when it came out. My point here,  is avoid this place.. service has been terrible every time and food is mediocre at best.

I googled to find a bison burger in my area..I was starving for a burger and im on a strict diet that still allows bison and I came across Tru burger & grille... Not only was I greeted promptly and sat in a fast manor, but my server Bo was just simply awesome! Super polite, got my order right, just very great at making me feel at home and being attentive without being over bearing.. My burger was actually cooked at medium and my egg was still runny the way I like it! This place is a little pricy, BUT worth every penny.. I would for sure recommend this place to anyone on strict healthy diets or looking for a clean eating place! I will for sure be back again even though I live on the other side of town!

Walked in waited about 5 min to be noticed, then they finally took us to the table where we waited over 15 minutes for someone to come up to us. After 15 minutes someone asked if we been helped and we said no he said he was going to send someone right of way, but no one showed up after another 10 min went by so we got up and left. Horrible customer service will never go back to it. Then again west side that's what you get.
A little pricey for burgers but very tasty and our favorite Park West resturant. Service os speedy and the happy hour drinks are fantastic.

I have never had a better burger! The zucchini fries were to die for! Just happened to be in the neighborhood and hungry so I stopped, I had never eaten here before but it was worth the drive, will defiantly come back soon.

This company is the example of Down Town vibes brought to the West Valley. If you are tired of driving down there, tired of the rude and nasty Down Town attitudes and want the same feeling then come down to the TRU place, TRU BURGER.   I have been coming to this place before they changes their name. I see now that they have new prices, new drinks and the same amazing burgers!   I feel like this is a place of enjoyment and a place where you can relax to have some easy sit down fun. The fried food is absolutely amazing, the drinks are well made and very cost-efficient.   This place makes me want to move into the apartments right in the Plaza, who knows... I just might end up using this place as my personal kitchen!    5+ STARS and 1 Cosmic Star
Too pricey for a dry burger. I can make a better one on my grill. Also Park West reeks of sewer, have fun eating while smelling that!
Everything is an up charge. Both times I've been there has been good. They do tend to make your order incorrect. Will possibly try them again

If I could give it 0 stars I would.  Can't comment on the food because we walked out but the service was terrible.  Sat down to have a server throw the menus in front of us and run off to help people who came in after us.  They were already ordering food before anyone even asked us for a drink order and then promptly threw the other server under the bus.  When we complained,she didn't even offer to get the manager.  She just made excuses and let us walk out without even an apology.

They don't just have great burgers.. I love the chicken sliders-mmmYum! But  what really has me yelping is the sign I read that said Pets Welcome :))) next time I go to the BluBurger, my beagle MaddyMay is going too!

I usually bet burgers plain to start.   It has to stand alone first.  I got the Bison Burger, $15.00.  It was dry, I expected a dryer burger because the lack of fat in Bison.  Asked for Medium Rare, got Medium-Medium well.   I took a picture then enhanced it, to deepen the color.  I suggest you use the burger as a delivery system for toppings.  Put 3 of the strongest toppings, maximum sauces to give it flavor.   I would happily pay $5.00 or $6.00 for this burger.  I have had bison fir years, most of the time it has flavor, sometimes it tastes of feed lot....  No taste at all.    In fact I suggest you bring your own cheese, a Limburger, Maytag, or one of the strongest cheeses to give it something!   About a table spoon of Tobacco Sauce or  Dragons tongue pepper would help as well.     The burger was from frozen bison and had to have been pressed, and turned serval times to get it that dry.  For $15.00 I expect fresh not frozen meat!     The wait staff was very good.  I will not penalize the waitress to inferior food....  Or fast food quality burger.

Habenero Burger - (MR) arguably the best burger I've ever eaten. Fresh bun, flavorful habenero sauce, and everything cooked perfect from sauteed onions to a perfect medium rare. Salad was a side note with good bleu cheese dressing.   Sports TV for the wandering eye or weary traveller, uh me.  Changed a TV to Rousey vs. Tate replay..... Stoked!    Full bar for those looking, doesn't jive with family friendly atmosphere or food.  Opinion - more local beers on tap and ditch the liquor, evaluate business swing either with and without.  Thanks Blu,  Super Good!

Solid burger place. Gave it a 4 b/c only one burger place in my opinion is a 5 in this world and that Kuma's Corner in Chicago. If you're ever in Chicago go there no matter how long the line is...its 100% worth it! Anyway back to this place...started off with the wings which were okay. I'm more a dry rub kind of guy when it comes to wings and these wings were swimming in sauce. The wings I thought were cooked well just to "wet" for me. I then had the bleu burger which was really good. The burger was huge which is always a plus in my book and then caramelized onions, nice thick bacon, and blue cheese all worked really well together. Finished the meal off with a "pizza cookie" or "cookie pizza"..something like that..which was essentially a huge cookie in a small pizza pan type of dish with vanilla ice cream. It was a nice sweet way to end the meal. Bottom line if I want a burger I would def. come back here. Only downfall I really experienced was that getting the food out to us was a bit slow in my opinion and I'm not sure if our waitress had a hearing problem or something but I had to keep repeating my order. Anyway that stuff wouldn't keep me from coming back here. Solid place.

I haven't been here for sometime and thought I'd go back since going to a movie. I had the Kobe burger and it was very good. I like the fact you can build your own burger to how you like it and it's a good size burger. Service was good as well and like the fact that the movie theater is walking distance.
Amazing food and the servers were on top of things! All four of us ordered different burgers; all of which were impressive. I also had the zucchini fries which are very tasty as well.

This small burger joint was a pleasant surprise.  Local grass fed beef and bison on the menu.  Service was great and the food was delicious.  While we were there a family showed up with thier dog.  The dog was brought water first.  Gotta love a place that treats animals just as well as thier customers. I will be returning soon.

Great service.  Walked in, greeted immediately and seated in a booth.  Wait staff was attentive and made sure the drinks were always full.    Food was good.  Variety of burgers and toppings were plenty.    Price is OK.  The burger prices are reasonable.  For the price of the sides, I would have expected larger portions.

During a day of shopping, my best friend suggested that we grab some food from Blu Burger Grill... I had never heard of it before, and I wasn't exactly sure what to think... considering I'm usually very picky about my burgers.   I decided to go with the "Build Your Own" Triple Mini Burgers and O-M-G. I LOVE them. Perfect size, perfect portions. And their pizza cookie is excellent as well!  Overall, this place is awesome. Excellent service, and excellent food. What more could you ask for?   My only problem with this place is that if you go for a booth, make sure you get it next to a window that doesn't have the blue film over it. You will start to find yourself feeling a little dizzy before too long.

This is just your average sit down burger place nothing special just expensive remember coming here when it used to be blue Burger didn't like it then didn't we like it this time for the $14 you pay for the burger must go somewhere else Burgers dry didn't like the bun taste a little stale no real flavor juiciness and everything server was kind of unattentive took forever get drinks probably never go back

Yummy burgers!!  And guess what?!  They do breakfast and you can bring your dog for patio dining too!!  They have awesome omletes and protein pancakes for those who are cutting calories.  Burgers and salad are awesome, its a lot of good so beware!  Try the sweet potatoe fries too. You have to try the burger with goat cheese its so good, it sounds gross but its not!  Pizza cookie dessert is like heaven served in a baking pan.

This IS A MUST try place! Had the kobe beef build your own burger....THE BOMB!! Brought my elderly mom (you know how they can be really finicky) she absolutely loved her chicken teriyaki sliders....her plate was clean when done!!  Server Brianna was helpful.
Can't review the food. Couldn't stay in there more than 5 minutes because the stench of the sewer was so bad. Shocked we didn't see that in other reviews.

Great service.  Great food!  Great times.    Outside is wonderful in the evening and especially on the weekend.  Inside is very enjoyable.  The game is always on on the numerous flat screen TVs hung about the place.  I truly enjoy it here.
Prices are ok, but the burgers and portions are huge! Free wifi... awesome location... I can't find anything bad to say about this place. I wish happy hour was better...

The lady behind the counter was super helpful and she caught a wrong order from the kitchen  but after being on the road for 6 hrs and calling ahead to get an order ready for pick up . We showed and had to sit for an additional 15-20 minutes while they fixed it- that sucked. I was ready to walk out if I wasn't stuck
Second time are at the one in Anthem service was slow and then the one off of Northern service was just as bad as Anthem. Food is descent but if I can't get service why bother?

I love this burger place it's cozy and nice not too loud had a football game playing but not so loud where u can't talk to others. The burgers were so good. I decided to try to create my own and got the Kobe beef burger and it was so good half way through it I was full but wanted to keep eating still didn't finish it but I loved my burger my husband got the American burger and he likes his as well. Prices are not that bad and you get a good size burger two hand hold kind or cut in half and eat. Definitely enjoyed my burger and will come back
Love this place.  Love being able to burgers in a healthy way.  Cole slaw best I've had!

My daughter & I just happened to find this place one night & I am so glad we did!  Absolutely one of my favorite places!  We usually get the turkey burger w/goat cheese & a fried egg & sweet potatoe fries.  They are more than happy to split the plate for $2 which you then get your own portion of fries.  They have a great chipolte mayo & red pepper sauce which we use for dipping our fries in which is super nummy.  Then for desert they have a chocolate chip pizza....basically cc cookie dough thats not quite all the way cooked with 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream....to die for!!!   I can't recommond this place enough.  It's not a real big place & the service is good.  Go to the Blu Burger & thank me later. :O)
Yum :) best burger I've had in a long time. Even my daughter who always just picks at her plate managed to chow down every last bite.
We have been coming here for 2 years. Its a monthly tradition.  The best burgers I've had in az. I recommend to everyone

The food is very good, but it is a bit pricey. It has a great atmosphere. I really enjoyed the zucchini fries not to soft and not to crunchy. I had the Southwest burger and it was very delicious I would definitely get it again! I like that you can customize your own burger and fit it to your liking. I like the bison burger, the meat is hard to describe but it's definitely something to try! The server that we had was really nice, gave us privacy, and refilled our drinks as needed. Great place to try!
Italian burger was juicy and tasted amazing. The mozzarella was so fresh! The chicken Caesar salad was amazing and fresh. BBQ burger had fabulous flavor!

I made arrangements to take a group of 18 neighbors here for dinner. Fabulous. Service was great & staff was very accommodating & helpful. They will get repeat business several people said they would be back.  My husband & I will be definitely going back. Great burgers like we had back in the 50's & 60's, juicy & messy.

We out the other night with my Girlfriend, and was craving a good burger.  Since this place is right next to where I live, we walked over.  Couldn't walk out fast enough.    If you are in the mood for a bland burger....this is your place.  And if you are looking for a place where the decor is as annoying as the bad service....this is definately your place!  ****UPDATE****  So, after writing this, I received an email from a person claiming to be the owner of the restaurant.  They said they were sorry for the bad experience, and would like for me to come back, all the while informing me that they had a hard time believing that the burger was just as I said....bland.  (Rule #1 in business.....Your clients perception is their reality)  After a few emails, this person asked for my mailing address, and again asked me to come back sometime.  To this day, I have not received whatever it may be that I was suppose to receive by mail.    I would encourage anyone who chooses to go to Blu Burger to just look for another spot.  In my opinion, your $ will be better spent elsewhere.
burger was good, service was great, the set up is ok but nothing i would expect for a high end burger joint.  too institutional feel for me, too bright or too something i just don't know?

Out shopping and found this restaurant tucked away in a shopping center. The atmosphere is really relaxed with great music playing and sports on. I will definitely be coming back to enjoy this place and their good food!
Pretty sure bison burgers were frozen patties. Not great for the prices. Expected way better based on previous reviews. We will not be going back.
I was incredibly surprised by the quality of the burgers.  The sweet potato fries were amazing.  Atmosphere and seating was great for a burger joint.  Zucchini Fries - really great as well!

There are SO many reasons to love this place, which is why I keep going back for more! If I'm having a bad week, it's amazing how "Let's go to Blu Burger" can turn everything around. (Pathetic? A little.  But this place is truly that magical.)  Reasons to love Blu Burger:  1) It's family-owned.  Rather than supporting a big corporation, you're giving your business to the little guy.  2) Great customer service.   3)Affordable. A burger-with-a-side is around the $10 range.  They also run a happy hour special - I believe Mon-Thursday till 6 - featuring some deep-fried appetizers and cheap drinks.  4) The location.  This is a great dinner-and-a-movie place, since it is right next to Harkins.  5) The food is SO GOOD.  I would like to personally recommend the buffalo chips, which are these homemade potato chips drizzled with blue cheese and buffalo sauce.  Dip them in the ranch and you will be in a food coma in no time.  The onion rings at this place are of the fat, beer-battered variety, also complimented nicely by the ranch. The sweet potato fries are delicious as well; I recommend those with chipotle mayonnaise dipping sauce. On a recent trip, I ventured outside my box and tried the wings.  Surprise! They are spectacular as well.  As for the main course, you will fall in LOVE with the burgers here.  I love the bison burger with all the trimmings, but the Kobe is great as well.  If you aren't in a burger mood, the "blu chicken" sandwich is a great choice (with ranch on the side for dipping).  I love how the side salads are of the leafy green variety, as opposed to the dry iceberg lettuce ones that are so common.   I was never a burger person before, but this place has turned me into a snob.  It's hard to go back to white-bread, greasy burgers after having the quality this place delivers.  Worth every penny!!

We had burgers and garlic parm fries.  One build your own burger and a bacon/cheese/with onion ring burger on brioche bun.  Burger was pretty decent..  cooked medium as requested.  Came out hot.  Warning...The garlic parm fries were like a punch in the face...not sure if they always come that potent but the garlic parm was strong.  Flavorful and tasty but crazy garlic aroma.  Actually was a bit much as we brought doggy bag home and not only stunk up the car but our entire fridge smelled like garlic the next morning.  They were good when eating hot and fresh but did not want garlic anytime soon after

I didn't know this place was a sit down restaurant I thought it was going to be fast food but I was in shock when we got seated. I ordered two appetizers for my table the fried pickles and the buffalo chips. The fried pickles I thought were going to be slices which they should be because it's very difficult to eat the fried pickle in a whole when it's hot. The buffalo chips with the hot sauce and blue cheese on top was just incredible such a simple idea that makes you so happy you got them. So I saw the build your own burger thing on the menu and decided to do that because I like making it my own. So sad knowing all the stuff I asked for went to waste because they got the main thing wrong for a burger. I asked specifically medium well and I got well done with no juice left in the patty. There was no taste in the meat. It was gross I didn't even wanna look at it to be honest. Burger place but the meat has no taste to it? Kinda weird no? I like fries on the side they were called Parm Fries or something those were tasty. Buffalo chips and fries are the only thing good here. 45$ for two burgers and one appetizer.. Plus a tip? So 50+$? Not worth it..

I've been to Blu Burger Grill a couple of times. The first time I wasn't blown away. It was good but not fantastic. This time was actually better. The manager that runs the place provides great service.  I ordered the mix basket and grass fed burger w/ tomato, spinach, red onion, pepper jack, and mustard on wheat with a side salad.  The mix basket came with onion rings, french fries, and sweet potato fries. It was hot fresh and tasty. the batter on the onion rings wasn't too light or too heavy. The burger was cooked perfectly and also delicious. the side salad was just OK. Nothing special nothing bad. My wife and I split the entire meal and were both full.  The bill came out to 26 bucks with drinks. Not exactly a bargain but we weren't eating at Wendy's either.  In summary, if you are in the area going to the movies or even a game at Westgate Blu Burger may be worth taking a look.

I eat here all the time with family and the food has always been great! Today I ordered the caprise salad with garlic parm fries (happy hour discount on the fries!). Its so frakkin' delicious! Chris, my server was a great smiling presence and kept my water topped off! 10/10 will nom again!

Let me start by saying I don't eat a lot of burgers, however, I still love some me good eats.  I was really looking forward to trying the Blu Burger Grille.  My love of all things blue (the color, the cheese, the fruit, etc.) had me ready to add Blu Burger Grille to my list.  While I can't say it was my favorite burger of all time, I can say they have a great concept and a tasty burger.  As many other reviews have mentioned, the decor is very blue and yet plain otherwise.  Not really a big deal, I don't like clutter anyway.  The Build Your Own Burger concept is great!  I could spend twenty minutes deciding what I'm going to order and discussing with the group what they are going to order.  With so many different options for the patty, the bun (or bun substitute), the sauce, the toppings, and the extras the combinations are almost limitless.  For those of us that can take too long to make decisions (guilty), they have a few suggestions for burger combos, another great idea!  Also, the option of salad, sweet potato fries, or onion rings as a side make a great menu in my book!  My California Burger with swiss, sauteed mushrooms, and avocado was pretty good.  The bottom part of the wheat bun got soggy quicker than I would have liked and the top seamed like a lot of bread, but the burger tasted good; I was too busy eating to bother mentioning it to the table.  Sweet potato fries were decent.  I also got to try a BYOB turkey burger and a Blu Burger.  I was very impressed with the moistness of the turkey burger and thought the amount of blue cheese on the Blu Burger was a little overpowering.  As I said, I love stinky blue cheese, but it is a strong cheese and you really don't need much to get the flavor across.  Overall, the options are fun, the burgers are good, service is fine and I left satisfied with no regrets.  Next time I'm in Peoria and craving a burger, I'd go back.

I visited this place two days in a row for lunch while working in the area. The food was really good, the service was great. First day I did the build your own burger with Kobe beef and the second visit was another build your own but with Angus beef. Both were perfect they also have Bison and other meats to choose from. I also ordered  both visits for the table a plate they called Buffalo Chips, they are either house/home made chips with Buffalo wings sauce, blu cheese crumbles, & Blu cheese dressing on them. Both groups loved them and would definitely go back again!
Horrible. My bread was so hard it felt like i was biting into a tumbleweed. I could use that bread to break a window. Crazy slow service. Ill never go back hope that place runs into the ground.

The food is exceptional here, especially the salmon and burgers.  The wait staff is awesome...one is just a bit too talkative at times.  They have an amazing patio that you are able to eat outside almost year around.  You will not be disappointed.

Awesome burger! I stopped by Blu Burger last week for lunch and absolutely loved their signature Blu Burger with Kobe beef. Definitely order their sweet potato fries with chipotle sauce....amazing!  Service was great, we were in a bit of hurry and had no problem getting in and out.

This place is becoming one of our regular spots! Our favorite thing to order there, oddly enough, is the chips and salsa. You've gotta try it! The salsa is perfect - not too spicy - garlicky, all the things salsa should be, and the chips come out fresh and hot. My husband always gets a burger medium rare, and has never had any complaints; he loves them! I usually order the portobello mushroom, on brioche, with mozzarella and tomatoes. It's really really good. They season the mushroom really well- lots of garlic on that, too; maybe don't order that, if you're on a first date  Everything's fresh and yummy, and the service is top notch!

I was very impressed by this place. I live in Vegas and was visiting Phoenix and looking for a good burger. Turned to Yelp and decided on this spot.   Very nice location in an upscale shopping area. We went at lunchtime and sat on the outdoor patio (which is dog friendly- pretty awesome). We were the only ones outside. The server was nice enough to change the channel to accommodate us and get some March Madness basketball on.   What with the build your own burger option. I got Angus beef, Applewood smoked bacon, garlic, red onions, jalapeos. Got a chipotle and habanero sauce on the side and the skinny fries. Was definitely one of the better burger experiences that I've had in the recent past.   If you haven't been here, I highly recommend you give it a shot. I will definitely go back if I'm in the area again.
Really good burgers. I had the green chili. It had a real roasted poblano chili on it . The guacamole was good and spicy.  I also had a kilt lifter beer , also good,

If I could, I would give them 10 stars.  We are from the Central Coast of California and were visiting GCU for the weekend.  We had lunch here on August 2, 2015 after shopping in the area.  There were 5 of us in our party and each of us ordered something different.  I had the Bison Burger.  The service was superb!!  We were seated right away and our order was taken quickly.  Staff was nice and friendly. Every meal was outstanding and went far beyond our expectations!!  We will definitely come back again and will recommend to all the GCU students and parents in our area.  Lori
Pretty good prices! Burgers are very big and super tasty. Love the presentation of the food and the workers were nice. Super clean too.
The food was really good. Kinda pricey for a burger but the quality is above par so it goes hand in hand. Service was quick and efficient.

We went to this wonderful hamburger place right before the Dixie Chicks concert! This had the best looking and best tasting burgers in the Phoenix metropolitan area! Hands down! We totally enjoyed our food! Bo, our waiter was a rockstar and impressive. We had a great time there, even though the people that were eating at other tables looked at us like we must be from Texas because I was wearing my cowgirl hat and my daughter was decked out in red, white and blue with a matching blinged out cap.. America! We wanted good hamburgers before the concert and we definitely found the hidden palace for burgers on the west side of town! Highly recommend!

I had kobe beef and my wife built her bison. She loved hers... I was pretty happy with mine.  Our server Desiree was really great! We were also greeted by a host who was friendly and took the time to ask us how we liked the burgers!   As someone who has worked around retail property management I've got this insane ability to pick apart stuff. I dunno if it's a blessing or a curse?! But... if I could suggest to the management... have your floor drains checked asap. The average customer isn't going to notice that not quite right smell. And for the love of all things, please especially have them service the one in the women's bathroom. That rotting smell is coming from the aging plumbing and organics from cleaning the floors going down the drain.  You have my word... I'll change this to 5 stars happily once I get word it's been taken care of!  Well done BluBurger!

Just starting out on vacation and not knowing our way around AZ, I turned to Yelp for a decent lunch spot for 5 hungry (borderline hangry) people. One doesn't eat health-food, or even vegetables really; One is nearly a vegetarian. Three of us would've eaten our own fists at this point.   Enter Blu Burger Grill. This spot seemed perfect, as they offered sandwiches, salads and the most enticing thing - build your own burger, where a 'burger' includes Beef, Kobe Beef, Bison, Turkey, Salmon Filet, Veggie Burger or a Grilled Portabella Mushroom. Sigh. Of. Relief.  This location is set up at a mall and seemed relatively new-ish. The decor (as mentioned in previous reviews) is hideous. But, we were seated right away and all seemed to find something we liked on the menu.  I went with the Build-Your-Own Bison Burger ($14) and was a little underwhelmed. They offer a lot of topping options, but the really good stuff is all $1 extra per topping. I got some veggies, cheese and added guacamole for $1 anyway and asked for the herb mayo on the side (sauce was a freebie). I thought my burger was okay but the bun was way too big for the amount of meat. Super bready and kind of hard - I ended up leaving behind over half of the bun. They didn't put much guac on and forgot the herb mayo, which I was pretty much over at that point. I opted for zucchini fries as my side and enjoyed them, though I thought they were a little stingy on the portion.   Everyone seemed pretty satisfied while eating (like I said, we were all starving) and I have to say the sandwich that looked the best was a Chicken Sandwich on what looked like sourdough.   The service was kind of slow, it was pretty packed and I think only 1 or 2 servers were working. Luckily we got our order in before the rush. Overall, I'm glad we went - everyone found something they liked and no one had to compromise.

The food was delicious. I had the blu burger which had grilled onions and blue cheese on a roll and it was fantastic. My husband had the American burger with sweet potato fries. His fries and burger were also very good. The onion rings that I paid $1 extra to have were just ok. I'm just not a big fan of that style of batter, but that's a matter of opinion. So a $12 burger +$1 more for onion rings seems a little pricey to me. It seemed like we came in just as the breakfast rush was winding down so it took a long time to get our food, and also a long time to get the check. I don't think I'd go out of my way to stop at this place due to the cost and service, but not at all due to quality of the food.

Wow!!!! This place is amazing, best jalapeo burger I've EVER had. Staff was super friendly but genuine, really appreciate this place! Prices seem high but comes with great fries and burger is delicious. Money well spent!! Keep it up!

We stopped in because we had some time to share before our movie and didn't eat yet. It did not disappoint us! I ordered the wings as a "snack", and I got so much food that I even had to bring some home! The bbq wings are DELICIOUS! Excellent service, and very clean restaurant. Definitely stop in when you're around! - we will be back, and next time we will bring family!
Awesome place! Amber was amazing! Gave suggestions very personable. Can't wait to come back. Bison burger was very good.

My bf and I both got make-your-own burgers (I ordered bison and he ordered kobe) and thought they were absolutely amazing.  There are so many choices. Make sure you go when you're hungry bc it is a LOT of burger! Service was fantastic
We love the burgers and the wait staff is always very pleasant. My only complaint is that the owners need to clean it up a bit.
Service was incredible and the burgers were just amazing. We're new to the Phoenix area, and we'll definitely be back again.

Groupon lured me in here, and I'm so glad! I'm not that "into" burgers, but my sweetie is, so I couldn't pass up the deal. The place is very clean and cool looking with the brightly painted murals on the wall. I liked that the menu wasn't over crowded with random options but still had something for everyone. We both chose build-your-own grass-fed burgers on onion buns, medium rare with different accoutrements.   Everything turned out great! Burgers were cooked perfectly, just the right amount of toppings applied, and they came out just as we ordered. Plus the servers were on the ball and super friendly. Also great were the sides! I got sweet potato fries but ate more of my dates zucchini fries instead. This worked out bc he ate more of mine than his. I LOVED the zucchini fries SO much, I will go back just for them. A great experience except for one tiny thing. It smelled funny inside! We got used to it eventually, but upon first being seated we both commented on the funny  aroma of the place. Hopefully this is not the norm. I thought it smelled fishy and could be attributed to the salmon patties I saw on the menu, but who knows. I will smell it again next time.

Another fun visit! I am a big fan of the Pear Chicken salad. Lovely goat cheese that gets all melty from the warm grilled chicken...mmmmm. The mango iced tea is nice too. Not too sweet or too fruity. It's nice to have healthy choices amid the movie theater and Grimaldis..which I love. :) Definitely hit this place up. The burgers are yum and definitely give this salad a try!

The service stood out more than the food. Our server was awesome. I had the bison burger, it was ok didn't taste well seasoned and more than likely not fresh but frozen patty and over cooked. To charge that much it should be fresh and juicy. My family ordered the Kobe burgers, not bad but nothing to write home about. We've been to way better burger bars to put it gently. Oh and green bean and zucchini fries were really good but you only get a handful of each. :(
Food was good as always.  The atmosphere is so cool with everything being blue inside.

Was a last minute go to but it was a good burger..we had a party of 7, 2 were kids, they had a good kids menu. They have build your own burger with pretty good building options,  they also have bison,  Turkey and chicken you can build as well. Burgers are a little pricy but good...a ok beer selection. They do have tip included for big parties FYI...

Good service but disappointing food. Our California burger was dry... Which is hard to do given then mushrooms on top. The buns were stale. My pear salad was full of flavors that just don't go together. We usually don't eat at places unless they are 4 stars. We made an exception on this one and we are bummed we did.

This was my first time at this establishment and after an amazing day at the farmers market we were ready to settle down and eat some delicious food. Instead we got 2 overcooked burgers and a combative manager. The manager was our waiter and forgot to bring out chocolate milk for one of the kids (not really a big deal). Two of our burgers were extremely overcooked, we asked for medium and recieved well done and we had to ask 3 different servers for napkins before we got them.  After I reviewed all of this with the manager/waitress she responded back with "First of all" and as you can imagine it all went downhill from there. She went on to say she's not back there making the food and no one asked her for napkins. I was absolutely stunned at the lack of empathy and ownership.   They say a manager can cost an organization millions of dollars and its the truest statement I've ever heard. She represents your brand and she represented it poorly.   We will NEVER be going there again

Never disappointed here.  Always trying something new then deciding that we have a new favorite.  Just had a daily special Buffalo Chicken sandwich that I hope makes it onto the regular menu. Hard to decide between garlic/Parmesan fries or the sweet potato fries.

The manager is so nice! He let me and my boyfriend in after they closed to enjoy a drink while waiting for our movie! So polite I really appreciate the good customer service! Will be back to try the food. Glancing over at the other tables that were still finishing their food the burgers looked delicious!
Came here the other week and got the habanero burger and zucchini fries... so yummy. The staff was also super friendly!

Had dinner here last night. Cute place but for what you spend on a couple burgers, fries and beers you could do better elsewhere. I only gave this place 3 Stars due to the prices, long waits to be acknowledged at the bar, and getting our first round. Started out with the buffalo wings, with mild sauce and that was pretty good because they were crispy. We were seated at the bar when I noticed the couple next to us seemed to be waiting a long time for their food. They ordered grilled cheese sandwiches and that was at least 20-25 minutes.  Next we received the Burgers we ordered a few minutes after we finished the wings. Perfect timing! The Burger I had was the Angus with Bleu Cheese. Awesome!  Fries were nothing special. Luckily for me I requested 1000 Island on the side because had it been on the burger I would have left. I had a feeling that would be a wise move because after tasting it I noticed a heavy dose of cinnamon in the dressing.  Whoever had the idea to do this should be slapped. Don't overthink things people, 1000 the traditional way is what I was after. Wife had the Kobe burger. Loved it and she chose wisely with the onion rings.  I was jealous!  Way better than the boxed frozen variety. Anyway, I'd come back but this place appears to be run by amateurs. I don't want to be mean, but the lack of teamwork and everyone on the staff looks like they just do kind of whatever they want. Maybe a good candidate for Kitchen Nightmares or Bar Rescue.
The food was mediocre at best and the service was terrible. I would recommend looking for another burger joint if that's what you are in the mood for.

I'm not generally a big fan of burgers, but I love this place!  Their "blu burger" is amazing!  Bleu cheese crumbles, carmelized onions and thick, crispy bacon on an awesome onion bun, oh my!  I highly recommend adding avocado to it as well.  I can't speak for the other sandwiches because I love the blu burger too much to order anything new. Heh.  The zucchini fries are a thing of beauty AND they allow well-behaved dogs to hang out with you on the patio while you enjoy your meal.  They even brought my little guy a disposable water bowl!  I've also had great luck with their waitstaff, everyone is friendly and on task.  It's pretty busy on a Friday or Saturday night, but just perfect for a Saturday afternoon lunch.

I ordered fish and chips.  Not the best idea in a burger place.   They were more like fish sticks.  Tasted like they were frozen and heated up.   Another person at our table got cold fries and all he things on her burger she asked to not have on it.    Maybe caught them on a bad night.

Great raw ingredient used for their burgers!  Angus. Thank you for being thoughtful.  Wonderful menu choices. Hubby thought the Califfornia burger was "bland".  No pizzazz.  My American Burger nice and American.
First time I came here I thought this was so so. But going back recently at the request of a friend. I did a build your own with angus beef, ham, mushrooms, spinach, tomatoes, garlic. Really good!

Nice burger joint. Chris tool good care of us, ask for him. We split a bison burger. it was very tasty with chipotle mayo and spicy mustard. The zucchini fries were crisp. The cole slaw was good, not too soggy. The tropical tea was yummy.
Best service. . Great food!!! Burgers are great.. staff is very friendly..great selection of drinks. . Best place in park west by far..buffalo chips are by far the best

Gave Tru Burger a 2nd chance. Was extremely pleased. The buns were fresh and tasted like the original buns. The burger was once again juicy and delicious. The zucchini fries are the best. Our server has been there for years and she was absolutely wonderful. Just saw that the owner had responded to my previous review. Judging by our meal on this visit, it was evident that management cares about their customers' opinion. I will definitely be back.

Good food. I chose the custom burger. 2nd best sweet potato fries in Valley IMO. Nice that they don't charge extra for them. Just a bit pricey, but it is sit down service so it makes sense. Very friendly and immediate attention.

The only place I found that serves organic non-hormone feed meat and fowl!  Food is great service is great!!  I have been here a half dozen times and I have not been disappointed once! Yum!!! Just delish!

Tru Burger Co. is a casual build your own burger place with wait service and a comfortable dog friendly patio. They are located in a shopping mall that's one exit from the sports arena.   We sat ourselves on the Dog Friendly patio and quickly we were handed menus. Our server soon greets us with a fresh bowl of water for my dog.   We started with the Green Bean Fries as an appetizer. We received a very generous plate of Fried Green Beans with Dipping sauces. One sauce was a tasty creamy but mild wasabi. The green beans were very tasty but also very substantial. I had to stop eating them or I wouldn't have room for my burger. My dog was very fond of the green beans and they kept her occupied as a train ride strolled by the patio with screaming children. (I was afraid she might bark at them) ($5.95)  I tried the Salmon "Burger" wrapped in lettuce and some toppings and onion rings with habanero sauce on the side. My salmon filet was juicy and was seasoned nicely. The onion rings were tasty and the habanero sauce was HOT, really hot and tasty with good flavors. This wasn't a burger that I could pick up and eat. I had to eat it more like a platter. ($16.50)  My husband had the Green Chili Burger with Grass Fed Local Beef. It's an 8oz burger and it came with a tasty chili and not a canned chili. He asked for it medium rare but it came out well on one side and pink on the other side. He said the beef had good flavor to it but the burger wasn't juicy as he was hoping for. He did tell the waitress it was ok..........($14.25)  My husband isn't much of a fish person but he thought my fish burger was delicious and he also liked the onion rings and habanero sauce over what he had.  I'm really feeling a 3.5 today on this place but I rounded it up because of the friendly efficient service, nice patio and the tasty platter I had.  Prices run on the high side and slightly higher than what the website had posted (4-1-17) but the ingredients they use are costly so you have to keep that in mind. The burgers on the suggested menu can save you a few dollars rather than the build your own section.
Some of the best fried pickles I've ever had!  Burgers we're good, service was great!  My yelp app froze when I was trying to redeem my offer but they honored it anyway.  We will definitely be back!

This was my first time trying this place and I was very impressed! My friend had the Tru Breakfast but subbed the bison burger for a regular angus beef burger, and I had the Italian burger. Both were cooked perfectly and tasted excellent! I was surprised at their selection of different meats (ranging from kobe beef to salmon burgers). It's true their menu is only limited to mostly burgers, but they do have other things to snack on (hot dogs and other such things), but if the place is called Tru Burger Co. then I would expect that from them. The service is very nice, and if I had to pick one thing to gripe about it's that the food took quite a long time to come out given the sparse amount of customers that were in the restaurant at the time. I know I wasn't the only one who thought this, because a couple of the other groups in the booths started to look around for their food after a while. The food was worth the wait though! And it wasn't that long of a wait; just long enough to notice. What really made me happy was that while the regular Tru Breakfast is around $16 they lowered the price for my friend's substitution! I don't recall the last time that happened anywhere I've been (since usually prices are set and substituting cheaper ingredients changes nothing). Can't wait to try this place again and try my hand at building my own burger next time! They have that option as well!

Considering this place allows you to create your own burger I was expecting something a lot better. But maybe I was just setting my expectations too high. My husband had the angus burger and I opted for the bison on wheat with spinach, caramelized onions, jalapenos, chipotle mayo and a side of zucchini fries. The fries were excellent, but they serve you such a small portion. 5-6 fries and gone! Burgers were satisfying, but not sure if they were worth the price. For that price for a burger and a tiny portion of a side I'd much rather go to Delux or Fez.

I had their "Kobe" burger with bacon, blue cheese and A1 sauce. It was a really big burger! Everything seemed to be fresh and of good quality. But I found the meat to be kind of tasteless. It was good enough though. I'd eat there again given the opportunity. The fries were really good and so was the service.
This place is a real find. The best burgers in pheonix. Sweet potato fries, what a treat!

Was shopping the farmer's market Saturday with my friend and we decided to grab a bite to eat before heading back home. The smell of burgers wafted through the air as we shopped the market so we hurried around it and made our way over to Blu Burger. The restaurant is indeed BLUE...so we sat outside on the patio which was lovely.   I originally went in intending to order a burger but quickly found that the menu boasted many other choices that looked appealing. After much deliberation, I settled on the Grilled Chicken Sandwich with a side salad of mixed greens. The salad dressing was a mango vinaigrette that was delicious! The sandwich was served on whole wheat toast with tomato, avocado, applewood smoked bacon, romaine and a light spread of mayo. It was a wonderful tasting sandwich and the salad complimented it perfectly. I will order again for sure next visit.   My friend ordered the bison burger (no bun, wrapped in lettuce) and the side salad without dressing. Per all her special requests, the meal didn't look one bit appetizing to me. But again, if she weren't on a special diet and received the order as it comes, it may have been more appealing. Nonetheless, she said she loved the taste of the burger--her first time having bison--and would order again.   Between the delicious meals and very attentive waitstaff, I'll be taking the hubs here to try out for himself in the very near future.
We go here weekly with our dogs and we will keep going back. The staff is always on point for the most part lots of changes lately but the food has stayed consistent.

Well, we gave it another shot. I ordered the same burger as last time (California burger) and ordered it medium. I told the waiter that last time my burger was overcooked so he said he would make sure it was perfect! When it came out, it was.... Very well done. :( I told the waiter and he sent it back. It came out again well done. So three times now they have not been able to properly cook a burger!!! It was still tasty because of the toppings but I wish they knew how to cook a burger properly. Otherwise, only offer well done burgers because that's the only way the cooks know how to cook a burger.
I love a good burger and Tru Burger is one of the best burgers I've had in a long time. The staff was very welcoming and nice. Will definitely be coming back.

Walked in here before a movie. It was a chill evening and the people were so nice. We couldn't leave. Skipped the movie and just kicked it here the rest of the night.   The playlist was strong. The drinks were good. We ordered some snack food (fries and buffalo chips).  Highly recommend.
They have a delicious turkey burger.the service was great and fast.i would definitely return in the future

First time I've ever left a restaurant hungry.  I ordered well done honey hot chicken wings and I got rubbery undercooked wings in honey.  Asked for blue cheese and got ranch.  Asked for 2 boxes and got one.  Waitress laid out straws out on the table.  Can't see why I would return here.

This is the place my wife and I go when we want a hamburger. A REAL hamburger. When you have a burger craving and no flimsy fast food hamburger will do the trick, come here. Best bets are the titular Blu Burger and BBQ Burger.

The grilled chicken sandwich here has me almost aroused. It's two slices of the most amazing sourdough bread that's been toasted to perfection, with a succulent grilled chicken breast, under lettuce, tomato, and mustard. A bite of this sandwich feels like sheer perfection in my mouth. The bread alone had me asking them where it comes from, it's a local bakery, go figure. It comes with a side of fries and they are nice and crispy. The decor is very blue....but I like to sit outside anyway.
Clean, good but not the fastest services.  Can get pricey as well.  I would go back in a heart beat if I could

Fine, but too expensive for the quality. I would suggest better bacon, seasoning the fries and having A1 for the burgers and fries. It's in a convenient location for me, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get it.

Great burgers. I had green chili and hubbies had Calif burgers. Both cooked to our order, medium, which was juicy good. The buns are wonderful and fresh.  The calif had fresh greens.  The zucchini fries and onion rings were also very good.   The wait staff was very responsive and friendly.  We sat on the patio and it was beautiful outside. Nothing I could complain about.  Read some of the poor reviews, and disregarded.  I heard good things from others who had been here. Glad I checked them out.  We will be back!
Awesome lunch menu! Try the Kobe beef its delicious! This is absolutely one of my favorite places to eat. It's got a unique vibe and atmosphere.

Expect to pay $10-12 for a decent burger and fries in a tacky, blue-themed interior in cafeteria-style tables and seats.  The happy hours isn't bad, as it boasts some reasonable and fun appetizers along with $2.50 IPA drafts, among other options.  The service was decent, but not great, and the ambiance as a whole didn't seem to be worth the prices on the dinner menu.  At least, I can think of several better options.

This is a 1 star rating only AND ONLY because they closed the Peoria location. Blu Burger which then became Tru Burger was the BEST place to get the most delicious burger you could ever imagine. But, they chose to close this location and have lost 1 dedicated Tru Burger fan. Back to Island's Burgers for me because my favorite Peoria Tru Burger location has closed. :-(
Good quality burger. Decent service. But I've had better and it was a little pricey.

Pretty good place.  I believe it's the same menu from when it was Blu Burger Grille.  Servers name was Bo and he was terrific, very friendly and attentive.    I had the Bison burger and it was on point.  They made it medium rare and had quality Apple Wood Bacon.  My kids both had the American Burgers and they enjoyed them.  My girl had the Tuna sandwhich and she said it was great.  Total was $65 which is not bad for a family of 4.  I preferred this place to Red Robin because they have Bison meat.    I would reccommend coming in.
Tru Burger has become a regular for the hubby and I. Great burgers and excellent service! Highly recommend the sweet potato fries!

We had a great experience at this Blu Burger Grille location the other day, so they are a 3.5 to a 4 star rating and nothing "blue" about it ; -)   Restaurant ~ as stated in other Yelp reviews, this place is literary "blue" everywhere. Even if your not a fan of the blue color, the blueness starts to fade after a while and a few drinks.  It is conveniently located in the Park West Plaza ~ 101hwy & Northern in front of the movie theater.  Service ~ was great. Our server knew their menu well and was able to answer all of our questions.  She was very attentive to our needs and kept our drinks filled.  Food ~ they offer Angus beef  and turkey patties for their standard burgers.  They also have a build your own burger where you can choose grass fed beef and bison as well.  We went with the grass fed beef and the bison burgers.  The meat was cook very well and was mouthwatering delicious.  We chose their onion and white buns for our burgers.  They were a bit too big for the burgers but tasted ok.  They have several choices for burger toppings to choose from.  Your burger comes with fries, but I upgraded my fries to zucchini fries.  Both were unappetizing and needed to be doused in catchup or ranch dressing. Their onion rings and sweet potato fries were not really any better.  Their salad was very fresh and flavorsome.   Side note ~ I love blue cheese on my burgers, but if you order their grass fed beef or bison burgers you may want to skip ordering the blue cheese because it can mute the taste of the beef.  You don't want that beefy goodness to restrained or diminished in any way.   Recommendation ~ give this Blu Burger Grille a try next time your in the area and craving for a tasty burger.  Go for the grass fed beef or the bison, skip the fries and go for a side salad.  You won't be disappointed.

Wow!! I was blown away by this place! I've come by this place a few times when going to the movies and always smelled delicious. Tonight after seeing a movie, I decided to try this out with my family and I have to say the food was really good! The meat was delicious and the servings are HUGE! I would defiantly recommend this place to others and come back here. It's so worth it

I'm a huge fan of  cheeseburgers, they're my favorite. And right now I've got to say that Blu Burger is my favorite place to go for a good burger. Plus their fries are delicious which is a huge bonus. I've always gotten good service here too. And their lunch menu has killer prices!

Solid burgers and better food than there used to be. We've had some quality issues here before, but went again for their anniversary special and were pretty impressed. My burger came out as ordered and the toppings were nice and fresh. Overall, I can't complain.

Good burger  Bleu burger is good.  Sweet potato fries are okay  I prefer my fries hot not warm.   Had a glass of water and added doterra peppermint drops and then saw that my glass had lip stains on it. That sucked.   Overall service was ok. But not great just okay.   Overall experience 6/10
I work in Park west and stopped by tonight.  The girls are sweet and the food is good.  Simple as that.

We were sat by the bathroom and the place smelled horrible when we asked to move they didn't want to move us to someone else's table.
