We decided to stay for appetizers and drinks and after the 3rd time of "I'll be right back" when we wanted to order appteziers we simply asked for the bill and left. I will not be back.

I will give this place 5 stars because it has a variety of food but healthy.  The burgers are excellent and you can "build your own".  I love the Cobb salad.  The staff is always attentive and accommodating.  The restaurant even allowed my dog on the patio this summer during and outdoor luncheon with my friends.  I wish we had more places like this where costs minimal compared to quality.  WE HAVE NEVER HAD A MEAL WE DIDN'T LIKE.  (bison and Kobe beef on the menu)

I love Blu Burger, but I'll admit, I get excited over it mainly because of its location in the West Valley. It's nice to have an upscale burger place nearby. I always get the veggie burger here, and it is actually really good for a veggie burger. Most restaurants serve a run-of-the-mill veggie burger that tastes like its been in the freezer for 10 months waiting for someone to come in and order it. But Blu Burger's are great and very fresh, and unique tasting. It keeps me coming back for more, when I am in the neighborhood. If i had to pick one thing i don't like about this restaurant, it would be the aesthetics. The over-saturation of the color blue is a bit much. I don't really like everything to have a blue tint to it (including my food), but that's just me. For one thing, people look horrible in that kind of lighting too. Wouldn't want to go on a first date here!!! The blue windows need to go. It's a bit much...too harsh. But all in all, great service, great food, and great location. Two thumbs up!!!

We tried their signature Blu Burger and a build your own with the Kobe beef. They were both great and very large. We tried regular fries, zucchini fries and onion rings. The zucchini fries were awesome! The only bummer was there weren't very many. The sides are definitely not for sharing. Another con is that they actually have a split plate charge of $2. That really bothered me. Overall, great service and good food! Next time I am trying a $3.50 milkshake.

I thought I would check back and see how the reviews were going as we tried this place a few months back and our experience was somewhat similar to a previous review indicating disappointment with the vegetarian options. While they credited back the cost of the veggie burger that I indicated I did not like, it was disappointing to get what I am pretty sure was a supermarket gardenburger brand veggie patty, that could not even come close to the outstanding gourmet quality veggie burgers we get at Zinburger or Delux burger, perhaps my expectations were too high. Even though they credited it back on my bill and I did not have to pay for the veggie burger, the owner was a bit rude when I indicated my concern via the website, don't know if he was having a bad day with other complaints as he seemed angry that I posted my complaint so soon and that I did not state they credited back the cost of the burger, or if that is just the norm response, everyone has bad days I guess, so in fairness to them I deleted the previous review. In any event, I see they now have some sort of mushroom burger on the menu that they are calling a "portobello mush" according to their on line menu, so in all fairness I may give them another chance, maybe try the other location, and see how that is as a vegetarian option.
The food was excellent the stag was nice it wasn't very busy when we're there. The bathrooms could have been cleaner but over all I would go back!

My friends and I were looking for a new place to go because we were feeling adventurous and we were so glad we found this place.   It was about 4pm on a Saturday and we walk in as a group of ten and were seated right away. We were served by this super cute and fun server named Corey, I believe. He was very laid back and have us great suggestions on what to get (though I think it'd be difficult to find something on the menu that wasn't absolutely delicious).   We got a ton of appetizers to share and they were all great. The green bean fries were delicious along with onion rings, french fries and sweet potato fries. We also got an order of some amazing potato skins! Then we each got a burger. There were so many options from salmon, to three kinds of beef, to portobello mushrooms! There were all kinds of toppings and condiments too! I especially have to rave about the zucchini fries that I ordered with my burger instead of french fries. PHENOMENAL. Seriously.   Plus, they had a ton of beers on tap which was awesome! A lot of times you go to places advertised as "bar and grille" and they don't have a wide variety but everyone got something different! My bill (including 25% tip because of the awesome service) was about $18! Not bad, I'd say!   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone! Make it a date night too because there is a movie theater within walking distance! Love it!

I really have no complaints about this place other than the time it took for our food to come out, was longer than the people next to us that sat down after we ordered. Anyways, the burgers were amazing. I got the BBQ burger with sweet potato fries and my boyfriend got the habanero burger. I tried some of his burger and I will definitely be getting that burger the next time we go. If you love spicy food, the habanero is where its at. We also started with some zucchini fries before our meal and they were delicious!

Wouldn't go back.... They're not as good as they think they are. Tried to pass off canned mushrooms as sautd mushrooms. The Kobe beef wasn't exactly bad but not as good as Kobe should be. Even my husband's basic BBQ Burger was just"eh" :/

I love the color blue.  So when I walked in, I fell instantly in love with the decor.  We were greet immediately and sat in the tables in the middle of the room.  Review the menus and cool idea, Build Your Own Burger!  Total of 6 steps...  Pretty cool, since I am kind of a picky eater.    I got the angus beef (well, no moo-ing), wheat bun, swiss cheese, and mayo.  There are a ton of other selections to add, but I am a plain jane when burgers come into play.  Got the side of fries.  For a burger that is well, it was still very juicy and tasty.  Not dried and hockey puck style.  I was very happy...  Then...  dessert time...  Got the pizza cookie!    Very good...  The comb of half baked cookie and ice cream with all the good food put me into a food coma...    Our server was great and attentive.  The manager stepped in to help the server during a slight rush of people, he was attentive and funny.  Loved the personal attention we received.    Great food + great service = excellent dining experience!

This is a great burger/sandwich place. The food is amazing! They have a variety of meats that you can choose for the burgers, such as bison, turkey, and salmon (to name a few). We started our meal with an order of onion rings. They were cooked just right and my kids devoured them pretty quickly. I had a bison burger on a wheat bun with sweet potato fries. It was so juicy and delicious. As I'm writing this review, my mouth is watering...lol My husband had the pastrami sandwich with fries. On their website they didn't show a kids menu, but they have one. Kids can choose from mac and cheese, burger, chicken strips or grilled cheese.  We love when drinks are included with the kids meal...gotta save money somewhere. The kids meals also come with their choice if fries or Apple sauce.  My kids had macaroni and cheese with fries, a kids hamburger with fries and chicken strips with fries.  The chicken strips looked hand breaded and juicy too. They have a full bar and happy hour every day. The sign outside says new owners. We were not disappointed at all and will definitely be back. The food was fast and super yummy.

Went here last night with my parents. We stumbled upon this restaurant after the one were going to was too busy. Their decor was so nice, very clean. We sat on the patio and loved it. It was nice to see it was dog friendly too. I got the BLT with zucchini, my dad got the green chile turkey burger with zucchini and my mom got the special of Lemon pepper salmon sandwich with sweet potato fries. Everything was very tasty. Zucchini was really crisp and tasty. My BLT was really good! My dad loved the spice of the green chile turkey burger. And, my mom liked her salmon sandwich. Service was great from our server Beau! Can't wait to go back with my husband and try the burgers.

I'm from out of town and just wanted a good burger. In Southern California where I'm from we have lots of burger bars and they're always competing for business so I just wanted to try this burger bar I sat at the bar and waited 3-4 minutes before anyone even asked " can I get you a menu" I said sure and how about a glass of water. Got a menu right away took another two minutes for the water. They asked for my order when the water arrived I said give me a minute. That was a mistake it turned into 5 minutes. Now I've been there for 12 minutes and have not had my order taken. I ordered the Angus burger build your own and fries. I see all these positive reviews talking about yummy hamburgers and I'm thinking maybe I just went there on the wrong day. My burger was mediocre the bun was cold it had been grilled but was not warmed up. Fries were okay definitely not the best not even close McDonald's fries are better. When they brought up the food I had no utensils I ordered side of mayonnaise side of ketchup none of that came out I had no napkin no knife and fork. They finally brought out all my utensils my side of mayo and a bottle of ketchup I've had better burgers at Dennys. I'm pretty sure the meat was frozen and then thawed out or it may have been a pre-made patty definitely was not fresh or hand pressed. I wouldn't recommend it to anybody I'd rather go to Burger King McDonalds In and Out Burger anywhere but here.
5 out of 5 stars simply for the fact that it was the best burger I've ever eaten. Kobe beef, any bun, blue cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomato, pickle, a1 sauce. Off the chain!!!

We were in the area to see a show in the Jobing.com Arena and this particular location was in a shopping plaza near there.  They are on the end corner close to the movie theater and this offers a decent view from both inside and the porch outside.  The ceiling feels endless in here and it's very open. There are several TVs throughout and they are playing a variety of things, but if a game is on, this wouldn't be a bad spot to sit and watch.  We both created our own burgers - I had blue cheese and garlic on mine and he had caramelized onions, ketchup and cheese on his. For sides I went with fries and he opted to get onion rings for $1 more.  Everything was made to order and the burger was a perfect medium as requested.  The fries were good, as were the onion rings - although we debated the extra cost for them, but hey, it's only $1.    Our server was very nice and handled everything quickly and checked back regularly to ensure everything was good.  They had some yummy looking desserts on their menu, but we were pretty full and on a time schedule, so we skipped them this go around.  Overall: A Definitely a good burger stop off and next time we'll know to save room to try dessert!
The service was wonderful. Everyone there seemed so nice. I found the burger to be just average. I think I have had way better burgers at other places. Maybe I'll go back and try something else.

We stopped for lunch, sitting on the patio. We split an American Burger with thin fries. The burger was perfectly prepared and the fries were great. We also shared an order chips and salsa. These were fantastic. The waitress could not have been any better. Will definitely want to come back here again.

Although today was my first  "check in" at Blu Burger, I have been there several times. Today, however, was unlike any other.  Normally when I visit BBG I down a turkey burger with a side of fries and I still somehow manage to shove a pizza cookie down my throat. Today I was lured to try the portobello mushroom burger... I will never eat a turkey burger from BBG again. Aside from all of the delicious condiments that you can choose to put on your burger, the portobello is marinated in a great balsamic dressing, which leaves it absolutely juicy and perfect. I did not even bother to ruin the luscious flavor with other condiments.  Every time I visit BBG the staff is warm and welcoming. They are very fast and your food never takes too long to get to your table. It is a great place to hang out with friends or even go on a date. Needless to say, my "check in's" at Blu Burger will continuously grow.

What a great place to grab a burger!  No matter how you want it, this place will grill it up just right.  I was surprised when the bill came that it wasn't as expensive as I expected.  The bar could work on creating some better specialty drinks but other than that, I would go to this place again.
Best burger joint in town!!! Wings are on point and Caesar salad is awesome!!! Love this place!

First of all, the burgers are delicious! No complains about the food. My family and I enjoyed every bite. The only thing I had a problem with was the service. It was a little slow at the time, but the service wasn't very good. It took a little for us to get our drinks and not to mention our refills. Also, when we wanted to pay for our meals it took awhile as well. Again, the food was delicious, the service is a little slow, but they are very nice.

I rounded up from 3.5 stars. It was good, but just missed the mark in a few spots.   The selection was great. Overall, it was good. We got a grass-fed and a bison burger. Both were slightly over cooked (which happens when grillers leave them on as long as regular beef). Zucchini fries were very yummy. Onion rings were cooked great. And sweet potato fries were good, but lacking seasoning (debatable, obviously).   Also had a milkshake that was decent, but tasted of chocolate powder rather that syrup. The blue film on the windows makes for blurry viewing. On the upside, our service as fantastic.   All in all, I would go again and would tell my friends to try it. For that, I gave them the round up.

I walked in and thought they forgot to put the lid on a blender full of smurfs... BLUE... EVERYWHERE.....   After I got past the atrocious decor, I ordered Wings mild, a appletini, kobe Burger and Sweet potato fries.   The wings - they only had mild and hot when it came to "buffalo" flavors. I ordered mild, but preferred a little more kick. They were really good and juicy.   The martini - ick ick ick too much crown royal.... wouldn't think I would complain about too much alcohol in my drink. I told the waitress and she didn't do anything. didn't offer to replace it or take it off my bill.  The Kobe burger - hmmmm I ordered medium rare and it came out "gray." It tasted ok, but something just wasn't right with the meat. and I was disappointed that it was over cooked.   The sweet potato fries- excellent, but you get a very small amount as a side to you burger.   I would possibly go back and try a different burger.

Came here on a Thursday night and it wasn't so busy. There were 2 servers working and it seemed like they were running around all over the place.   Service was really good from the manager.. Seems like he should be getting the tip instead of our server. I ordered a build your own burger and wasn't even finished telling her what I wanted on my burger and she interrupts me asking if I was fries or salad. That was a bit rude.   Then comes the wait for our food... We waited 45 minutes for 2 freaking burgers and fries!!!! For a place that serves only burgers it shouldn't take that long to cook. I got the Kobe burger. When my food finally arrived my top bun was cold and bottom bun was soggy! They first couple bits was pretty good until I got to the middle of the burger and my patty started tasting like raw meat. Eww! And the fries were flavorless.  I don't think the burger was worth $15. I could get a quicker and better burger at Habit burger.
Great lunch menu! Amazing sweet potato fries!! We definatly will be back. Perfect spot to eat before the movies as well.

Pros: Solid burger, huge portion excellent ingredients and taste. Got the breakfast burger which had an egg and bacon...don't cringe it was awesome.  The cons were very long wait...crazy long and the price is expensive.
Nice patio to hang out at happy hour. The happy hour guacamole and chips is outstanding. Great hamburgers and salad.

It's blue, like sad, food is not too good.  They copied Deluxe in Scottsdale, that place is the one to go too.  It busy, tasty, and fun.  This blu burger is not, but the fries are good.  Interior is nice but I think the staff just gots to be more friendly.  I feel like I am the one being judged there, it should not feel like that.

Love Blu Burger. They have one of the best build your own burger selections around. Today I created a bison burger with portobello mushroom caps as my "bun", with spinach, grilled onion, goat cheese and chipotle mayo on the side.  They've repainted the wall with a beautiful mural that makes the atmosphere delightful. Staff is always awesome even when the joint is hopping and they will do what it takes to accommodate a request(like mine).

Very good service, the food was good, the sweet potato fries really hit the spot and the atmosphere is also very inviting. My only peeve was the the decor was a little weird, but I'm not eating the decor so I could handle it. I do go here very often and enjoy it every time
Great burgers and service. They messed up one of our burgers but fixed it right away and comped it. Burgers were perfectly cooked and the fries pickles are amazing!!!!!
Yes the Peoria location has closed. They have RELOCATED to Mid Town Phx  2325 N Central Ave, Phx Opening late Summer Please visit us at our Anthem location until then!!
Good place they just need uniforms so it's more consistent and people remember the uniforms not just every day clothing they look like the customers just need some uniforms

Food was good. Liked the build your burger options. My only advice would be not to sit in the back. It REEKED of sulfur and bleach. The "Employees Only" door was open and beeping the entire time we ate. I left with a headache from the smell and beeps. But I wasn't hungry anymore. So, there's that.

3.5 stars  The overly blue decor did not bug me, as it has some previous reviews, but I will admit the space is lacking a bit. The service was super friendly and attentive, but then again there were only 2 other tables there when we arrived, so a drink never went empty which is always nice.  I love the build your own concept for a burger. I love burgers and it is nice to have creative control. I also really liked that they had sharp cheddar as a cheese option, I really love sharp cheddar on a burger. I went with the standard Angus and the burger was juicy and tender. I asked for medium and I ended up with medium well, but it was still good. The husband went with the Kobe Beef and couldn't pick out a huge difference between his and mine- something to consider if you don't feel like spending $3 more.  My biggest concern are the fries. I went with regular fries, and maybe I am becoming a fry snob, but I wish that they were fresh cut. I knew right off the bat that they were from a freezer bag and while they weren't bad, I would of loved some fresh cut potatoes with a bit of skin- it would of added to the whole experience for me.  Overall tasty burger with a lot of options. I hope they start picking up with business, it is nice to have a good burger place nearby.

Yum yum yum! I just had a delicious burger because I built it myself. For 10 dollars you can customize your own signature burger and also get a delicious side. I loved their crispy onion rings and tasty zucchini fries!   The service is pretty good and you don't have to wait too long for service. The one thing that makes this place stand out is their amazing manager! He's helpful, courteous and welcoming. I have gone here twice and each time the manager was busting his butt to get food orders out, greet people, and clean tables. I loved  seeing an attentive manager like him. The staff themselves are good too. Thank you for the yummy food!!

Ordered a Bison Burger with Zucchini Fries and Turkey Burger with Herb Mayo and reg Fries.  Also had Buffalo Chips.  The burgers were EXCELLENT!!! The Buffalo chips were MEH!  We will definitely be back.  Great burgers, great service, great time!

Pretty yummy stuff! Took my significant other for lunch and the service was speedy, friendly. Will definitely come back. I had a burger that was Hawaiian and he had a bacon egg burger. With zucchini fries on the side. Delicious!
I love being able to build your own burger and eat sweet potato fries! I love all the options available to you while eating and my daughter loves the kids menu too!

We stopped at Tru Burger Co. before heading to the movies.  It was a Saturday evening, but we got right in.  The restaurant seemed to get busier after we arrived.  There is ample seating inside, as well as an outdoor patio seating with misters and a sign that says "dog friendly".    My husband and one daughter had the BBQ burger, which had thick slices of bacon, onion rings, sharp cheddar, and BBQ sauce on them.  I had the California burger, which had an herb mayo, swiss cheese, fresh mixed greens, avocado, and grilled mushrooms.  My other daughter had chicken fingers.  All three burgers were cooked to perfection, huge, and piled high with toppings.  We also had fries, onion rings, and sweet potato fries as sides.  Everything was delicious, and I was particularly fond of the sweet potato fries.  They were cut thin and so tasty!  My only request would be that they offer some sort of dipping sauce to go with the sweet potato fries, as I don't enjoy them with ketchup.  Service was prompt and friendly and the prices were good.  The restaurant also offered a bar, with a menu of drink specials, lots of TVs, and was quite clean.  We will definitely be back, next time we go to Park West.

The service is always great with April, the place is always clean, and the burgers are amazing! Try this: Kobe beef, green chile, bleu cheese, buffalo sauce, lettuce, on a wheat bun. It's what I always get and I love it.
Very high quality food at a reasonable price ... bison and kobe beef burgers with ypur own personal picks, who could ask for more
I  this place great service my favorite MANGO TAANGO Drink! Amazing burger cook Elias Rocks' Server attentive and mgr Christy did a great job on checking on our dining experience!

Well unfortunately I had to take this place down a star upon our recent visit.  First I want to say our server was really good.  She provided excellent service.  But the food was extremely subpar.  We were craving burgers (hence why we came here) but honestly they were pretty flavorless.  My son's burger was completely burned which he failed to tell me until he'd eaten half of it so I didn't complain.  And as usual, I feel the kids meals are way overpriced.  In fact, at most places, I don't end up buying kids meals because of this.  My kiddos usually split an adult meal.  But the menu here is not that big.  I just really feel they are a ripoff.  Also we were informed our favorite burger was taken off the menu.  So we most likely won't be returning.

We went in for Mother's Day without a reservation.  The manager meet us at the door and was able to seat us right away.  Our waitress was named Stephanie and she was so awesome. She was very friendly and took the time to small talk with us even though they were crazy busy. She provided me with my free Mother's Day mimosa and gave us time to look over the menu.    We did the Mother's Day special and had the bruschetta, green chili burger and the BBQ burger with brownie for desert. The bruschetta was pretty good nothing to special but good.  The green chili burger was decent, the pico de gallo on the burger was a bit too much for me.  The BBQ burger was flippin amazing, I found myself hoping my boyfriend would get full so I could eat some of his (he did share).  The brownie was amazing and warm with warm chocolate drizzle that went amazing with the vanilla ice cream.
Very quick seating time. We loved the food and it also came out quickly. My only problem was our server was very slow to come around and seemed to be preoccupied with other things.

Burgers were great, decent beer selection and zucchini fries were awesome.  They seemed to be understaffed and the one bathroom working was disgusting. Might have been off night for staff (very busy night).

Difficult finding a burger place where you do not have to leave feeling guilty with your top button undone OR leave still hungry because you had no choice but to order a small salad with a few fries from someone else's plate. Tru Burger offers gluten free options, and tons of organic choices for your burger that also includes non-hormone fed meat(s) aka happy cows. Salads are also huge and taste very fresh. Leave feeling perfectly full and satisfied.
The food was really great! Burger was on point however, maybe it was because we came on Father's Day but the service was really slow!! Zucchini fries were the bomb!

Lot of hype from other yelpers, very bland show. Went here for lunch and the place was almost empty. Server was nice. We both ordered the beef burgers, mine a custom (wheat bun, medium cooked, provolone, greens, tomatoes, pickles). My wife ordered the American burger. While both were ok, they weren't anything spectacular, which after reading several yelp reviews is what we were expecting. My wife literally said "I could have had the same thing at Dennys". Plus, both were cooked to well done (when we had asked for medium), which lead to some of their generic flavourlessness.   The regular fries were the same, and my sweet potato fries would have been better if they weren't heavily coated in large flakes of salt. It made them nearly inedible.   The fried pickles were the only thing we both liked, and even then, the batter was so crunchy and dry and bland. While we were happy they were fried pickle spears  (instead of chips), these only ok guys were the best part of our meal.
Great food excellent service. Highly recommended it would definitely come back. Your employees and staff is very friendly and helpful.

This place rocks! I am not a huge burger fanatic, but this place will be my go to place when I'm craving a big juicy burger. We were looking for somewhere to eat before the Guns n Roses concert and everything at Westgate had a long wait, so we ended up here and I'm glad we did. The service was great and we all loved our food. I built my own burger with jalapeos, green chiles and buffalo sauce and paired it with a side salad. I ate every last bite.  If you are not in the mood for beef, they also have turkey, salmon and veggie burgers as well as a variety of salads and sandwiches. You can't go wrong here!

Went for dinner last night...it was delicious, as usual.  But, a little sad, it turns out they're closing this location and opening in Phoenix (near Durant's).  One of the best things about this location, was it's close proximity to us...when we wanted a really great burger, this was our go-to.  I had the Blue Burger, which is my favorite...angus beef, blue cheese and caramelized onions on a brioche bun...with a side of the garlic parmesan fries...so good!!  Hubby got his favorite, the Green Chile Burger with grass-fed beef and a side of onion rings.  Everything was perfect, including the cook on the patties, a juicy medium.  They're closing the doors April 15th, and we just might have to make one more stop here before then.  We will miss you!!!

I went to TRU Burger  Company on a Friday afternoon during Lunch time and sat at the bar. I wasn't really greeted right away but everyone ended up being very friendly. I ordered a Jalapeo burger with a salad. The burger was really good, super spicy but good and cooked to temperature. The toasted bun was a deal maker and I feel it really made the burger. The salad had fresh mixed baby greens but I had to chop it up quite a bit, since the pieces were a tad too big.  I think I'll come back again soon and have a beer from their vast selection or a Mimosa on a Sunday ($3). I don't have much else to say, I was satisfied and the food was good but nothing blew my socks off.. and for a $12 burger. In this day in age restaurants really need that one special WOW factor in one way or another and I haven't found that yet at TRU.

Its a burger place with a trendy spin on it, its not too sporty or loud.  Their menu is pretty limited and well all they basically have are burgers, but they are good at it.   To me its a much better option than BJ's brewery or Gordon Biersch

I love this place still!  It's amazing and for they have a delicious portobella burger and some very yummy salads!  Service was once again great, and I'm happy to see some place so consistently good in the west valley that seems to be hard to find out here.

(Shhh, I'm trying to stay awake at work, so writing this review!) Last Saturday, out-of-town friends and I found ourselves in this neck of the woods for the first time to visit the monstrosity that is the sports arenas/shopping malls. (NEVER AGAIN!!!)  Made our first mistake going to a Yelp approved Mexican joint that made us pay a cover charge to enter, that promised they'd have seating inside, but didn't.  We were hungry, so we were happy to find that this place had seating and was not crawling with drunken wrestling fans.  I was particularly thrilled with their milkshakes for $3.50!  My Bison Burger was HUGE (1/2 pounder), but I think I made a mistake and should have built more toppings into it, because it was overall a bit dry.  For you non Beef eaters, they also have salads  Owner and Servers were friendly, and I liked the blue, clean ambiance.  It did it's job well!

Really good burgers. I love how they break everything down and you can truly create you own burger down to the meat, the bun, the toppings and the sauce. I've seen this place packed. So be sure to call ahead to see the wait time. Also sign up for the rewards you get 10% off and other great coupons!

My wife and I where going to the movies and stopped into true burger co. This place was really good. I am a burger guy and I have to say I am stuffed. I ordered the BBQ burger and it didn't disappoint. I highly recommend this place to bring the family.

I love the turkey burgers and skinny fries from this place! It's hard to find some good turkey burgers at restaurants and this place has exactly what I like. The only downside is that they close early 8 PM. And the place is a little on the small side but other than that the service was good and the food was great!

Been here once and would keep going back. The fried pickles, oh my god. Anytime I see fried pickles on a menu I have to get them and these were gone in a few minutes. My burger was great. Sweet potatoes fries were on point. Server was very nice and attentive. Just overall a great place with nice people.

Burger was pretty good other than a hard bun kind of hurts your jaw to chew. Butone thing that WILL NOT bring me back is a employee was putting ointment on his obviously new tattoo where people could see him and HE DID NOT WASH HIS HANDS  so gross just imagine the blood borne pathogens and skin he put on stuff. NEVER AGAIN will I be eating here.

This place is great for grabbing a bite before a movie.  It is literally across from Harkins Park West.   We came on a Friday night.  It wasn't too busy and we were greeted quickly.  We sat out on the patio on a nice cool evening and had an enjoyable time.  They have a great selection of burgers, pretty much anything you want on a burger.  The burgers with fries are over $10 a pop.  Two of us had dinner with tip for about $40.00.  I had a super tasty burger with green chilis, bacon and cheddar cheese.  I got the skinny fries but you can upgrade to sweet potato fries or onion rings.  They also have garlic parmesan fries which I will try next time.    I would eat here again.  Great for date night or chatting it up with friends on the patio.  Check out their menu online for more of their yumminess.  Bonus, the patio is dog-friendly!  Love that!

Good burgers just a little over priced, did the create your own burger with grilled onions american cheese and thousand island dressing, that's how I like my burger. Service was a little slow and only two waitresses working that night but very friendly, music was little loud and hard to have conversation with others in our party.

Maybe they make great burgers but we can't recommend it for drinks and munchies. The atmosphere combines the sterility of a Formica covered Greek diner with the snootiness of haute cuisine. Our waitress seemed put out by our presence when we stopped in for drinks on a Saturday night. Didn't care for the buffalo chips. Onion rings were fine.

We noticed this place when we were looking for a meal before going to the theater across the street.  We were seated quickly and the server was very friendly and attentive.  The menu was mostly specialty burgers of various meats, toppings and buns.  Pretty neat if you are in the mood for a really well made "build your own" burger, or if you want to select one directly from the menu.  We noticed that salads and a few other items besides burgers were available.  Also, there is a full bar and of course many beers available to accompany your meal.  Our waitress was great, she suggested the onion rings, but I didn't really think they were that special.  Overall, it was a great visit.
Very good veggie burger. Waitress wasn't very friendly, but the owner was extremely nice and accommodating. I'll be back!

Service was great, fast and helpful. I ordered a basic cheeseburger with seasoned  fries. The burger wss thick, juicy and cooked to a perfect medium rare. Very tasty and worth the price. I will be back to try more options.

Burger lover's dream! Try the blu burger & sweet potato fries. They also have "build you own" burger options and various apps. Their chips & salsa was delish! Great selection of beers on tap including a beer brewed in Flagstaff. Definitely going back again soon.

Husband and I both had the build-a-burger. He had the Kobe fries, and was very happy with it.  I had the veggie burger with spinach, egg, and chipotle mayo on a whole wheat bun, with side salad. It was a foodgasm. I've had veggie burgers all over, and this is the only one I really loved besides Morningstar.  It was nicely flavored, had a pleasant texture and was cooked nicely. Most veggie burgers I've had are mushy, dry or both. Blu Burger's was perfect.  I agree with the other poster that the bun is too thick. I ended up slicing some off the top and that worked.  The only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars was the server didn't check back on us after delivering our meal, and the place wasn't busy at all (I saw 2 or 3 servers on duty). Everyone was friendly though.  Cool decor, clean, music at talkable volume.
YUMMY!  We were very pleased with our burgers. We both ordered the parmesan garlic fries and they were ok, next time we'll just get regular.  The service was excellent.
Service real good and food delivered quickly . Big Kobe beef hamburger and good sweet potato fries .

If God created a burger better than that of Blu Burger Grille, he must have kept it for himself.   Kobe beef? Bison beef? Even Salmon? These are all fantastic things you can make your burger out of.   The way rad thing is that the whole "build-your-own" isn't like any other restaurant. You can build it with ingredients not found at other establishments and you even have quite the assortment of buns to choose from, as well as sauces. I won't go into detail of all the combinations because I am terrible at math (And almost went batty trying to figure out all the drink combos at Sonic).  I would also like to commend the restaurant on their quickness. They were packed due to their inside having some sort of function and our server was still prompt and we got our food in what seemed under ten minutes. I was very surprised.   Also, sweet potato fries? Boy howdy these were awesome.

This place is so delicious!  We only eat the salads here but the salmon is so yummy...we go here all the time because it is a quiet and quaint place to grab a salmon salad (you can choose from like 5-6) and a glass of wine or beer. I love sitting outside when it cooler. Service is typically decent, only had an issue one time where the owner had to get involved because we ordered takeout and the waitress wrong it up wrong. She couldn't figure out the math unfortunately and it took 4 people and 20 minutes to straighten it out. We have been going for so long without issue, we just decided not to do take out anymore. I don't think you will be disappointed.

Place three orders they were great. Burgers had good taste, juicy, and big. But all of us (3 people) ended up with a severe stomach ache, lasted till the next day. Damn, I did not order McDonald's and paid $45 for three burgers. For that reason, I will not be a customer again.

Best burger I've ever had. Hormone free high quality beef you can taste. They have every sauce and topping you could ever ask for. We both created our own burgers with kobe beef (worth the extra $1!). I recommend the red pepper mayo. Skinny fries and sweet potato fries crispy perfection. Can't wait to create another burger next time!

I must say I'm not a big burger person, but this was pretty great!  Appetizer i thought was the highlight.   Home made potato chips with buffalo sauce i think ranch  (which is funny cuz i hate ranch) and blue cheese.   Entre, i had the make your own burger.   Black Angus medium rare pickles swiss cheese and fresh mozzarella lettuce wrap...   Although it was more one piece of lettuce on top and on bottom so of course it didn't hold very well.   Hubby had the  California burger but changed meat out to Bison medium well.  I had garlic fries for my side and he had onion fries.   He ate all my fries!!  Grrrrr...   =P"   The lemonade was good not too sweet and not too overly tart.   Over all good experience and good food.   For military fams they do have  Mil.Dis.  =)

If my rating was strictly based on food, I would rate this place 4-4.5 stars. The burger I had was good but the decor made it difficult to stay and eat. I understand the name of this place is Blu Burger Grille but does everything have to be blue? I wanted to give 4 stars but I really couldn't because the decor made it unsettling. The server (Stephanie I believe her name was) did a nice job and the food tasted great, so if that is all you need to enjoy your dinner, then this place is for you. In my opinion, if they added some other colors to off-set the blue the restaurant would be much more visually appealing and I would return but as it currently stands I don't think I will be returning to dine in.
Cool atmosphere but food is terrible . Frozen burgers super over cooked and bland fries. I would stop in for a drink but not worth what they charge for burgers

First time here sense it was Blu burger. Wow it was awesome. I had the special animal burger with onions and thousand island. Wife had the portbello mushroom burger with lots of topping. She said really good. On top of the burgers the sweet potatoes fries I could eat all night. Service good as food. Go support the business.

Food was decent, service was good, the bathrooms were disgusting. Informed the server about the restrooms and he did not seem to care. 2 not so happy experiences in a row here. I won't be returning. Not worth the money or the 18% gratuity.

Let me start out by saying that as someone who has come here about every 2 weeks or so for the last year, I think they have one of the best (if not the best) burgers and onion rings in the valley. If I was basing this just on food, it would get a 4.5 or 5 stars.   The customer service, however, that I have been getting recently has been increasingly terrible. Today was the straw that finally broke the camel's back so to speak and I finally had to post about it. To sum it up, when ordering,I asked for habanero sauce on the side of my to-go habanero burger so as to not have a saggy bun when i got home. When I got home, I had received none so I naturally called them up and explained it to the lady that answered the phone. She got the girl that took my order and the first thing she does is to accuse me of not asking for it on the side in a very annoyed tone. This was complete BS as I remembered the exact conversation as the lady interrupted my order initially when I was asking for the habanero sauce on the side. In the end she asked what I wanted her to do. I asked her what they normally do. I was offered the choice to either come back and get it (really?) or get credit for the free sauce next time. Needless to say I hung up laughing/in disbelief.  The whole conversion was very unprofessional. I have worked retail for 10 years and I would have been HORRIFIED if I overheard a fellow coworker acting like she did. This type of service has unfortunately become much more common. This once loyal customer is now starting to try and find a comparable burger place with better service.  Most of the food is AMAZING. However, you are taking a russian roulette-esque chance as far as customer service.  Edit: I don't think the owner endorses this type of behavior, however, more care needs to be taken when hiring employees. I have personally spoken with the owner in the past when his cell phone number was accidentally posted on the web instead of the Blu Burger number and he was a really nice guy that was engaging to talk to in a funny circumstance.  Edit #2: Recieved an apology from both the owner as well as the waitress in question. I gave them another try and they made the same mistake. I spoke with the owner over the phonne who was very apologetic, gave me his personal cell phone number, and refunded the meal this time.   The owner is really amazing I have to say, but they have made errors at a high rate. This has the potential to be a 5-star place if they make less mistakes than I have been witness to.    TBD...

ambience was nice. Seated right away. Terrible service. Food took about 40 minutes and all we ordered was a salad and a bison burger. The salad was like a whole 16 ounce bag of spinach with 1 clementine orange, cranberries, and a small amount of mozzarella. The bison burger which has an egg on it was somehow dry. Very disappointed. After such a long wait, you would think a manager would come out to apologize or anything for that matter.

Took the family here again, before hitting up the theater.  The service was excellent and our waitress was awesome.   As always, we start off with the fried green bean fries and buffalo chips. Unfortunately, we forgot to ask to hold off on the blue cheese and whatever that white sauce (couldn't remember). Our awesome waitress didn't hesitate to change the dish. After she corrected our mistake, my kids killed those buffalo chips. Those appetizers were delicious.   Then we went ahead and tried out something different. We tried the Philly steak sandwich and I have to say it was very bland. I ordered it without onions and then realized it didn't have the bell peppers. Up was up with that? But to be honest, I don't think it would of helped.  Anyways, I still love this place and will be back. Just going to stick with the habanero burger.
The beer sign attracted us to the restaurant and we had the fish tacos!  AMAZING!  You have to try it!

The handful of times that I have been here I haven't had a problem at all. There Hot Pastrami sandwich with sweet potato fries are too die for!! their fried pickles are delicious too the T ! I have munched of a friends plate to try her fried zucchini and those were great also. My boyfriend had a kobe beef hamburger and regular fries. NO WORDS. Very great food !!!
Yummy as always!!! Zucchini Fries and Homemade Ranch is the best!! Applewood Bacon is Bomb!

I have been here twice, both times great food short wait. This time they are  slow in the kitchen... due to a table of 8.... and they were short a cook. The owner put on an apron and got to work...Gordon Ramsey would commend him! The staff kept their cool and when people left before their food came they apologized and said Merry Christmas! I WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THIS PLACE!!!!

Soooooo glad you guys reopened this place  !!! It's a nice location - great place to grab a bite after work , watch a game or grab a bite before yr movie date !!! YUM !!   Good menu -good choices & I like the atmosphere !! Bad a bing !

In the Phoenix market there is stiff competition. Trendy burger joints are popular. Blu Burger, while not bad, is no competition.  Let's start with "American Kobe" as their 2nd meat option for a B.Y.O.B. There is NO such thing. There are people that will argue against me, but those people fall into 2 categories, those selling, and those that have been suckered into buying.  The fries and onion rings came out of a bag. At this price point I expect fresh.  The bacon on our burgers was great. The wings were pretty good.  Overall, the food is good. There are just too many places that deliver better quality at this price for me to be impressed.

We decided to go here because it was close to the theatre.  I have to say we were thoroughly dissapointed.  The burger was not very hot the bun ws cold the fries were cold.  The server was decent it just wasnt that good of an experience.  If you are lookin for a good burger check out Smash Burger. http://www.yelp.com/biz/smashburger-avondale

Food was terrific. I had a turkey burger on a gluten free bun and it was super juicy and the bread stayed intact through the whole meal. Sweet potato fries were cooked perfect and an absolute must with the red pepper mayo. My son had the teriyaki burger and it came with not only pineapple and teriyaki sauce but ham too! The server was top notch. Unlike previous Yelpers I did not notice any unpleasant smell nor was I put off by the amount of salt on my fries. The food smelled delicious and the taste did not disappoint. The size of the burger patties was generous and the meat, bun topping ratio was spot on. Definitely coming back.
Mediocre place with a weird cafe feel.. Food was not all we had hoped for.. But the beer was very cold and the AC was on!!
Love this place. Order on Uber Eats all the time and the owner sometimes surprises me with coupons! Great food and great staff. Two thumbs up
This place serves delicious burgers and the Scottsdale location is small but intimate. They have many varieties and their french fries, toppings, and sauces are amazing.

The food was great! My burger was perfectly cooked and seasoned. I had a side salad and the balsamic dressing was probably the best I've ever tasted. The wings were great. Moist, crunchy, and the sauce had a nice little kick to it. Our waitress was great. She was very friendly, made great recommendations and most importantly, kept our drinks filled! My only complaint was the decor.  As the name implies, everything was blue. The walls were all blue, every other window was tinted blue, so your food appeared to have a blue tint to it. It was a little off-putting.  They should rethink the blue and just have pops of blue with neutral walls and non-tinted windows. It would make the food more appealing to look at. I still give it 5 stars though!

In short: uninspiring. The blue decor is completely overwhelming and unappetizing. The meat wasn't as flavorful as I had hoped and the buns were huge--there was way to much bread to create a balanced burger. I judge this establishment against Delux  which I think is the benchmark for burgers in Phoenix.
Pricey for good, but average food. Left feeling like I spent too much for what I got. Paid for atmosphere.

The tropical tea is delicious!  Really well cooked burger.  They have bison, angus, Kobe, and more.  Amber was super fun, and never missed a beat in the 7 iced teas I had.    Also, start with the bacon cheese jalapeo fries.  Comes with an aioli that's great.  And, only $5.  We'll be back for sure.
VERY disappointed with the limited vegetarian options on the menu. I should have looked before I sat down.

While the food was ok it was just that.  It's hard to make a burger taste bad I mean it's a burger add bacon and cheese and you are good to go.  Blu burger is a new joint in park west over at northern ave on the west side.  The decor is nothing fancy painted blue inside all over and it is pretty basic I thought it would be a little bit more trendy.    The service was absolutly terrible the waitress too ten minutes to ask fir our drinks ten minutes to bring them then she left and ten minutes later she came back for our order after a manager asked if we had put it in.    Food arived quick my burger while tasty wasn't worth 11 bucks I had the blu burger which is the angus half pounder with bacon and grilled onions and cheese.  My side was sweet potatoe fries and they were good but cold.  The waitress never asked if I wanted ranch or hot sauce or anything.    In all I would say for a gourmet burger this isn't your place it's ok at most.  If u want a burger before the movie it may work for you.

The food is excellent. The service is superb. They allow doggies within the patio and will provide ice water for your furry friends. I stop by after my morning hikes w/my doggie and have a burger and some type of signature drink they make with Crispin, stout (I think) and ice.  It's such a refreshing drink! I once ordered the salsa and was skeptical.  I thought it wouldn't be good since it's a burger place, not a Mexican restaurant, it was fresh, spicy and delicious!! I absolutely recommend this place.

We stopped by there in our way back from Las Vegas and the food was really good. I was kind of scared to try it cause ive never heard if the place but very glad I did. Burgers are huge and definately enough to share. Sweet potate fries were good butnot anything special. I would definately go again!

Went in for dinner last night and ordered the BBQ whisky burger, lettuce wrapped with zucchini fries. The burger was pretty good, as were the zucchini fries. The ranch they gave with the zucchini was so watery that it wouldn't stick to the fries at all, it just ran off. Overall the meal was good, though a bit pricey for what it is.

As someone who visits Phoenix multiple times a year I'm always on the lookout for a place I'm willing to eat. I generally gravitate towards the local / mom and pop places but in Phoenix I've had very little luck. Was happy I looked into Tru Burger. If you're hoping for a quality hamburger place you have found it! A choice of patties including grass-fed, a choice of buns including lettuce wrap, and a choice of sauces. If you're into the heat try the habanero sauce, I loved it! If you aren't into the heat, definitely avoid it. There was a choice of sides including a fresh side salad, sweet potato fries, something called Skinny Fries. There were other things on the menu. But I was not focused on them. The lettuce wrapped grass-fed with the jalapeno sauce and extra tomatoes was outstanding! But I'm sure whatever combination you choose will hit your spot as well. I'm already looking forward to the next time I'm in the area!

The best burger place on the west side.  Food is awesome, tried the angus burger, french fries, zucchini fries (they are the best I've had in Az), onion rings, and Friday fish special, it was all bomb!  Service was great, our waitress  Bree was great and even the busser and other waitresses brought stuff out.  TV'S are spread out all over.  Great atmosphere, can't wait to go back!

The caprese salad with chicken is my favorite salad ever. The customer service was poor when I was there last weekend. We had 3 servers stare at us for almost 15 minutes before they helped us. It looked like they wanted to go home and we were the last table. I looked like they were making a bet who would get stuck with the last table even though they didn't close for another hour.

Worst manager Desire is passive aggressive, and has no formal restaurant or people skills. I will literally tell everyone I know not to eat there. I wonder if the owner knows what is running his business?? Into the ground? Can't believe they are still open

Tried this burger place for the first time after seeing the good reviews! I was not disappointed!! I ordered the special which was a guacamole burger! It was full of amazing flavor! The service was top notch! I might add that the sweet potato fries were quite possibly some of the best I've had! Seemed a bit on the pricey side for lunch since you have to leave a tip as well but I suppose thats getting to be the new normal!

I love the small, friendly atmosphere.  Amber was great from the start and made the experience the best!  We will be back as often as we can.  The Bison burger is fabulous and worth every bite of it.  So sorry we didnt walk in after a movie before now.

Going to update my review after actually trying this place, owner was nice enough to contact me after my first review =]  ......  Was going to try this place for the first time but apparently they close early if there not busy yelp says their open till 9 got here at 8:15 and it's closed with only one group inside =/
Food is overpriced.  French fries came cold.  Took over 1/2 hour to get two hamburgers and they were not busy.

Went by for the Saturday farmers market and noticed an ad saying new owners, the Chinese chicken salad was very good with sunflower seeds and citrus vinaigrette. Had the  roasted green chili burger with cheddar , chipotle mayo, and crudo, had nice heat ,the brioche bun was good sweet potato fries were good but came out tepid.
Love the good. The build your own options are amazing!! And the server Amber was fantastic. I will definitely be coming back. I am a burger junkie and this place is the best.

Love this place for many reasons:  1. you can get any kind of "meat" you want 2. you can put everything but the kitchen sink on it 3. sweet potato fries! They have great burgers, yummy fries and the best dirty martini I've had in a long time!   Is it gourmet? Nope. But I've also been to Deluxe, and wasn't impressed. BlueBurger is a great burger joint.
I got the jalapeo burger and my goodness it was great! Between the crispy fried jalapeo and the sweet jalapeo aioli my mouth was watering! Our server was great too!
Food is decent, service is decent.. Nothing special here.  Seems like a cheap ripoff ZinBurger.

Came here after today's Fiesta Bowl at the Univ of Phoenix stadium, which is very close by. (Too bad ND lost. Oh well.) We waited about 10 minutes for a table. The greeter did say that they got busy all of a sudden (because the game just ended likely), so he warned us the kitchen was a little backed up. But after we ordered I didn't notice until the burgers came out shortly after our appetizer. But it wasn't a problem at all. Our service for the meal was attentive and friendly. It was busy but we were never without refills.   The food was casual and very good. We ordered two burgers, one kid's burger and two sandwiches. Everything looked and tasted great!! The size of the sandwiches and burgers were giant and they came with your choice of side. The kid's burger came plain with cheese and was large as well.  I will say that the women's restroom was dirty and gross. The garbage can was overflowing. The floor was icky. I don't even want to talk about the toilet.   Overall, this is a great casual restaurant with delicious food.

Decently priced, great-tasting burgers. The fries are also fantastic, as are the chips and salsa. My fiance really likes their wings as well. The service is good, and the staff is always friendly. We have never waited more than a few minutes to be seated.

Best burger around these parts.  I had a turkey burger that was moist and flavorful, not easy to do with turkey.  I really like how you pick everything on your burger from the bun to condiments, some of the choices are interesting and tasty (raw jalapenos-hot!).    Onion rings were not greasy, but had tons of taste-didn't even need ranch or something to dip them in.  My dining guest had the veggie sandwich that was also near perfection, maybe just a touch too much oil on the veggies.    Only problem for this place is that the center is dead.  6 PM on a Friday and the place was not even 25% capacity.  I hope it makes it as this is a great place to grab a bite.
Kobe burger was great with zuchini fries...cold beer...only complaints is the mens room needs some serious help lol...always good burgers here!!

1st time eating here and the last. You can get a better burger at jack in the box. The burgers had an after taste like burnt char... taste like the grill and had no other flavor.   Best tip don't waste your time and $ dont go there.. not that great!

There was a point where I was considering giving up on Blu Burger. Apparently when they first opened, the place was quite upscale and pricey. My aunt told me that you could get some really high end burgers here but to expect to spend $20-30 per person.  If that is the case, we never went when it was like that. The current menu has been in place for a few years and I'm a fan of that. I will say that the American Kobe (which is a pet peeve. Kobe is from Kobe, Japan! The breed of cow is wagyu. I wish restaurants would call it wagyu!) was good but I didn't find it worth the increased price. The selection of toppings is great but some of the upgrades do cost extra. I personally wish caramelized didn't cost extra but that's not a huge deal. The fries and onion rings are both great. The sweet potato fries are not bad. For a while all of these sides were pretty bad. Everything tasted mushy. I have not tried the fried zucchini since the last time I ordered it. But that was back when I was thinking this place had gone downhill.  My last 2 visits were far better. I'm not a fan of the 50s decor but the food has gotten back to the point I remember when we first started going. My favorite burger is med rare. I like goat cheese, lettuce, caramelized onions, and whatever aioli strikes my fancy that day.

Nice, spacy good looking place. Inside and outside seating with a full bar.  I almost never get chicken sandwiches but I did today and it was great, the chicken was moist.  Our server Desiree was very kind and refilled our non alcohilic drinks often with a smile.   Worth a shot for sure.

Visited Blu Burger for the first time last week... enjoyed the food but felt it was a bit overpriced. I would go again but only if I was nearby. Other burger places that are just as good but not so spendy.

I got the BLT and it was good. Greasy and when you took a bite all the bacon came out. Just to break it up and reassemble it. Good though. Had a bite of my gf's burger. SO good! The meat had a great flavor to it and the green chilli was on point! We will def be back for more. Staff was awesome.

This place was so delicious! We brought our dogs with us and sat on the patio. Fast, friendly service and they accommodated us to move a heater closer to our table because it was cold outside that day. I ordered a custom-built burger and loved it! Deliciously juicy & packed with flavor. They brought out water for our dogs too. The only reason I'm not giving this a 5 star is because the bathroom and 20 feet outside of the bathroom smelled like fresh, raw sewage. It was such a strong smell and no one mentioned a word about it. I'm not sure if it's normally like that or if I happened to come on a day when a pipe broke. I would definitely return here and sit on the patio again though :)
Decent burgers.  Ok patio for our fur babies.  Very talkative server.  Little too much for our liking.
Good food, good staff. Grabbed a bite before a movie and have no complaints. Really liked the zucchini fries!

This place was amazing. My husband did some work for them not to long ago and told me to stop in some time. So I did with my 3 sister's. And we all thought it was amazing food and staff was so kind. We all got a little bit of everything. We had the chips and salsa. And that was amazing. The chips are warm and so tasty, we all had different burgers and amazing, sweet potato fries wow great, onion rings again wow, last the zucchini fries in love with them. Great place I would tell anyone I know to try this place out.    Rusk Family

The burgers were amazing and have great fries. Offered a gluten free bun that was the best I've ever had!  I had the green chili pepper burger, and would highly recommend you try it. Just the right amount if spice. The waitress was super nice and helpful too

Cheap happy hour specials 3 and 4 dollar plates. Typical bar food except somehow the Buffalo Chips were slightly addicting. They sounded gross but I could not stop eating them. Homemade chips, hot sauce, and mild blue cheese. For my meal I got the Kolbe Burger which was delicious.
Not so good.   The burger tasted like it was BBQd on a grill of charcoal that was lit with starter fluid.  The onion rings were not good at all. The fries were cold.  Won't go back.

I hesitate to write this review as I enjoy writing good reviews. This review is not meant to be mean or bash a place. Hopefully the management will read this and make the corrections necessary.  We started going to Blu Burger several years ago and had had good service. The food was reasonably priced and service good. At that time I gave them 4 stars. Then they changed their name to Tru Burger. The menu changes but the food was still reasonably priced and the service was good.  Tonight we ate there again. There was a sign that said under new management and a new attitude. I may of not quoted this exactly correct but this is close to what it said.  I ordered the cobb salad. I asked for blue cheese dressing on the side. After a 45 minute wait our food arrived. The blue cheese that was supposed to be in the salad was on the side and I had zero salad dressing. I asked  for blue cheese dressing and got two tablespoons of blue cheese dressing in a small cup with the promise he would open a new bottle and bring more. I waited and when none came someone else come over and asked if I needed something. I asked for olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The two was brought to the table each with less than a tablespoon in each. I was told they were out and also had no more blue cheese dressing. By now I had eaten most of the salad. I was brought two more dressings I did not like and did not use. I was then brought olive oil and balsamic vinegar from the kitchen. By this time I only had two bites left. We also had another order that was wrong and had to be remade.  I hope they can get their act together. I will give them another chance because of the location and the good service we have gotten there before.

lousy food.. expensive terrible business. 100.00 bill for 3 burgers and a salad plus drinks. not sure how they stay in business.. will never go back and tell everyone i kniw about the crappy food and terrible pricing. everything costs extra .. even bacon
